Google.title: North Wales Winter Climbing:Ground Up
Google.description: Definitive coverage to all the major winter venues; Ysgolion Duno (Black Ladders), Llech Ddu, Cwm Glas Bach, Cwm Lloer, Glyder Fach, Clogwyn Dh, Clogwyn y Geifr (Devil's Kitchen), Craig y Rhaeadr and Clogwyn y Garnedd (Trinity Face). The guide includes full details of new and previously undocumneted winter routes on all other crags in Snowdonia. There are also information updates and modern grade reassessments on a range of crags and routes.

Google.title: ! The Matterhorn : Steffen Kjaer
Google.description: No other mountain in the world is as fascinating as the Matterhorn. Since the dramatic first ascent in 1865, the drama and the myths have created a unique interest in this mountain, which has probably caused the deaths of more mountaineers than any other. Each year, thousands of climbers attempt to reach the summit, but only one in five succeeds. And every season, the mountain claims the lives of ten to twenty climbers. Steffen Kjaer describes his and his climbing partner Brian Jorgensen's attempt to make it to the summit of the Matterhorn. After careful preparation and perfect acclimatisation, they take off to face the challenge of their lives. On the descent, however, something goes wrong. All of a sudden, they find themselves caught in one of Matterhorn's countless and lethal rockslides... Besides following the author's struggles on the Matterhorn, this book also includes a range of short articles: it offers an account of the mountain's history, including the legendary first ascent in 1865, as well as a factual description of the symptoms and mechanisms of altitude sickness. Moreover, it contains portraits of local mountain guides and an eyewitness account by the former American President, Theodore Roosevelt -twenty years prior to his inauguration, he travelled to the Alps and climbed the Matterhorn. As a further bonus, the stories of the book are illustrated by spectacular photos taken by the author. Steffen Kjaer is a mountaineer and a journalist. In his books, he focuses upon the days in the mountains when fantastic experiences far surpass the risks they entail. He portrays life in the mountains as it can only be experienced in the light of one's own head lamp. For ten years, his best days have been those spent in the mountains, with ice axe in hand, wearing a backpack on his shoulders and his rugged mountain boots mounted with crampons. From his many climbs towards the most legendary summits of the Alps, he has collected the best stories of chance encounters with fellow climbers. He has often left the obvious track and so found new angles and perspectives in his pursuit of the ultimate stories and photos.

Google.title: Shockcord 2.5mm
Google.description: Vango Shockcord is what you need to replace backpacking tent pole elastic, repair clothing drawcords and carry out many other minor repairs on your kit. 2.5mm diameter is particularly useful to keep in an emergency repair kit, so you always have a means of attaching parts together.

Google.title: * Primus Express TI
Google.description: The Primus Express Ti is a minimal stove with maximal durability. It has a unique combination of low weight and durability. The fact that it can handle really large pots at a low weight of just 82g is excellent proof of the stove's capacity. A natural choice for people who need a durable stove in the wilderness. Comes with a nylon storage bag.

Google.title: Camping First Aid Kit
Google.description: Never be without a Lifesystems Camping First Aid Kit when staying in the outdoors - it's full of vital gear for treating common minor injuries. Zipped into a tough, bright red bag is everything a family or small group needs to sort out small mishaps - the sort that just happen when you're living outside. To ensure that you can go straight to the item you need, the case has a clear QuickFind system that shows at a glance where you'll find what you're looking for. And its compact size and low weight make the kit ideal for chucking in a backpack for a day out. A versatile and well-stocked kit that is a must for every camping holiday.

Google.title: Spectre 2 - 5 Pack - Colours
Google.description: A lighter, improved version of the original I-Beam krab; the DMM Spectre 2 has tweaks in all the right places: the only trad biner you'll ever need. The I-beam construction allows this 32g carabiner to amazingly hold 9kN with the gate open; an improved, deeper rope basket directs the load to the strongest point during a fall; and the shrouded nose reduces the chance of the gate opening when you really don't want it to. Ok, the DMM Phantom is lighter, but the Spectre works all year round - it's large enough to handle well even in winter gloves. If you count the grams but won't skimp on safety, you'll be more than satisfied with the Spectre 2. 5-pack of assorted colours means you can colour-code your gear - grab the hex you want first time every time. And of course, a multi-pack offers great value for money.

Google.title: Trisar 3
Google.description: For DofE, backpacking, trekking and beyond, the Wild Country Trisar 3 has the stability and weather protection to rely on all year round. Lightweight and free-standing, it's easy to pitch well even on soft ground and will stand tall through even the more bracing of 3-4 season conditions. That's because the inner-first design keeps the profile smooth, meaning that wind skims over it rather than knocking it about. The Trisar 3 is also robust, so you can expect it to keep you dry reliably for a long time with a bit of TLC. Tough, high performance ripstop polyester fly and groundsheet combine with Superflex alloy poles to not only last, but also keep the weight very reasonable for the protection. And with a versatile door and adjustable venting the Trisar 3 has the features you need for a comfortable trip.

Google.title: Trisar 3 Footprint
Google.description: Better protection and a longer life for your tent; the Wild Country Trisar 3 Footprint adds extra beef against wet ground and sharp objects. Shaped to fit precisely underneath the sleeping compartment of the Wild Country Trisar 3 tent, your groundsheet will thank you for laying out the footprint before pitching. You'll see the other benefits after a night on muddy, wet ground when you pack up a clean, dry inner tent. The footprint has its own storage sack that keeps it separate and compact in your pack... or on the outside when it's really mucky. A small addition that makes a big difference to the life of your tent; buy a Wild Country Trisar 3 Footprint to make a difference to your camping life too.

Google.title: Alpha Sport 25cm Quickdraw
Google.description: The DMM Alpha Sport 25cm Quickdraw is what DMM believe to be the ultimate solid gate, sport climbing quickdraw. And here's why: If you do a lot of sport climbing a solid gate crab makes sense. Bolt hangers can be very unforgiving of lightweight biners, particularly if you are dogging about and taking repeated redpoint falls. The Alpha Pro and Clip are robust and strong enough to cope with the typical sport climbing scenarios, but what really makes them stand out from the crowd are the exceptional handling qualities. The distinctive shape of the carabiners is no accident. The kinked back bone and grippy groove pattern on the apex of the spine are there for a reason. These biners are very easy to handle - something we are certain you will appreciate when stretching up to make that just-in-reach, gripper clip. The Alpha Sport Quickdraw has an Alpha Pro and an Alpha Clip linked by a highly durable nylon dogbone. It now comes with a stylish logo and at the rope end biner there is a neat, injection-moulded keeper. This keeps the biner locked down and correctly aligned, ensuring easy clipping and optimum loading. It also protects the webbing from abrasion. Taken all round this is a solid quickdraw with all unnecessary weight removed, that looks and feels as great as it is for all levels of sport climbing.

Google.title: North Wales Climbs
Google.description: The Rockfax North Wales Climbs Guidebook covers the best climbing from the whole of this huge and varied area. It includes all the routes from the 2010 publication North Wales Classics, with expanded descriptions and much bigger photo-topos plus many additional crags. The book spans the major mountain crags from Llanberis Pass to Cloggy and from Ogwen to the Carneddau. It also includes the Llanberis Slate quarries, Tremadog, the Moelwyns, the Gwynant Valley, Mid-Wales, Gogarth and the Ormes of Llandudno. As is normally the case with the selected Rockfax guidebooks, the choice of what to include is based as much on the crag it is on as the route itself. If a crag is included then they tend to include a good selection of routes on that crag. Crags described Slate Quarries - Bus Stop, Dali's Hole, California, Australia, Serengeti, Rainbow Slab, Vivian Quarry Llanberis Pass - Craig Ddu, Clogwyn y Grochan, Carreg Wastad, Dinas Cromlech, Scimitar Ridge, Dinas Mot, Clogwyn y Ddysgl, Cyrn Las, Cwm Glas Bach Clogwyn Du'r Arddu Lliwedd and Gwynant - Lliwedd, Clogwyn y Wenallt, Clogwyn y Bustach Ogwen - Tryfan, Glyder Fach, Gribin Facet, Cwm Cneifion, Cwm Idwal, Braich Ty Du, Carnedd y Filiast Carneddau - Craig Lloer, Carreg Mianog, Craig yr Ysfa, Craig yr Ogof, Lech Ddu Tremadog - Cwm Silyn (Craig yr Ogof), Craig y Gesail, Craig y Castell, Pant Ifan, Bwlch y Moch, Carreg Hyll Drem Betws y Coed and theMoelwyns - The Moelwyns, Craig y Tonnau, Carreg Alltrem, Clogwyn Cyrau, Clogwyn yr Eryr Gogarth - North Stack and Main Cliff, South Stack, Holyhead Mountain, Rhoscolyn Ormes - Upper Pen Trwyn, Lower Pen Trwyn, Castell y Gwynt, Castle Inn Quarry, Penmaen Head Mid-Wales - Simdde Ddu, Y Grisiau, Llechau Mawr, Barmouth, Craig Cywarch, Gist Ddu, Cadair Idris

Google.title: ATR-50
Google.description: Easton Mountain Products ATR-50 trekking poles are made for strength and comfortable use at low weight - ideal for long use on demanding remote trips. The strength comes from the two-part construction - fewer joints = fewer weak points - executed in 6063 aerospace alloy for rugged durability at low weight. Meanwhile, comfort is ensured by foam handles and neoprene-padded wrist straps. ATR-50s are also easy to lock at your preferred length; simply twist the RockLock clamp to set the tension, flick it closed and you're set for the day. Supplied with interchangeable summer and winter baskets they're ready for anywhere you walk - an ideal first pair of poles or for backpacking, trekking and every trip where reliability is top of the agenda.

Google.title: GravityWorks 4.0 litre Kit Bundle
Google.description: The Platypus GravityWorks 4.0 litre Kit has all you need to provide clean, safe water for a whole group on a long, remote trip. Not only that, it's extremely quick and simple too, filtering all 4 litres in only two and a half minutes. This one-off special deal includes the filter kit along with a full set of replacement parts and a bottle adapter at remarkable value, so you're covered for many trips' worth of use. The GravityWorks system takes the effort out of filtering water - simply fill the 'Dirty' reservoir, hang higher than the 'Clean' reservoir and watch gravity do the work for you. No pumping, no squeezing. You can even keep re-filling the 'Dirty' reservoir to have eight litres of water ready on-demand - ideal for a group situation when water's needed left, right and centre. Plus when you're on the move again it rolls down to a tiny size and weighs less than 350g. For easy filtration that'll go on and on, you can rely on the Platypus GravityWorks System.

Google.description: The Platypus GravityWorks 2.0 litre Kit Bundle is what you need on a long, remote trip to fill your drinking bottles with clean, safe water. Comprising the GravityWorks 2.0 litre Bottle Kit with replacement parts to keep it going for many a trip, this one-off Kit is available at a great value price strictly while stocks last. The GravityWorks system takes the effort out of filtering water - simply fill the 'Dirty' reservoir, hang it high, connect your bottle and watch gravity do the work for you. No pumping, no squeezing. There's even an adapter to connect through a Platypus Push/Pull Cap. Plus when you're on the move again it rolls down to a tiny size and weighs less than 350g. For easy filtration that'll go on and on, you can rely on the Platypus GravityWorks System.

Google.title: Mallorca Rockfax
Google.description: Mallorca has been a popular destination for British climbers looking for some sun for many years and this new edition covers the sport climbing and deep water soloing found on this Spanish island. The guide has been completely updated and revised and contains all the usual Rockfax features - full colour photo-topos, lots of colour action shots, easy-to-follow maps and lots of practical in formation on staying and getting round the island.

Google.title: 10.2mm Flyer II 50m Golden Dry
Google.description: This is an excellent climbing rope for the traditional climber who is not quite ready to take the big step to using thinner ropes. At 10.2mm the Beal Flyer is still not a large diameter, but is a good compromise between traditional ropes and the new breed of thinner rope. Flyer offers excellent handling qualities at a relatively light weight. For more information on beal technology and the beal guarantee click here

Google.title: ! Indian Himalaya Trekking Guide
Google.description: Detailed descriptions of 22 trekking routes in the Indian Himalaya. The routes have been especially devised to pass through the most scenic and culturally intersting regions of norther India. The information on the distance and time needed to cover particular route sections makes it easy for experienced trekkers and trekking novices alike to plan their trip in great detail. Each trek includes a 1:350 000 sale map and a height profile diagram.

Google.title: Scafell Summit Map
Google.description: Map excerpt showing summit and main approach and descent toutes. Large scale means it is exceptionally easy to see the detail even in poor conditions. Includes a 100m grid for ease of use with a GPS in complex terrain.

Google.title: * Cordillera Blanca Guide
Google.description: The Cordillera Blanca Guide introduces the traveller to the climate, geology and geography of this magnificent mountain range in the Peruvian Andes. It is the largest snow covered mountain range of the tropics, with a unique landscape and this is the only book in the English language which provides detailed information to the traveller on the natural history and geography of the landscape. The guidebook includes chapters covering climate and hydrology; the Andes; geology; mines, minerals and environmental pollution; natural hazards and disasters. Approximately half the guide covers eight detailed suggested trips going into the Cordillera Blanca, with information on logistics, main features, its geology and landscapes. The eight suggested trips are in these areas:- -Lima - Huaraz -Churup -Bosque de Rocas -Pastoruri -Paron -Chacas -Llanganuco -Chavin

Google.title: Antiball Plate G10 New / Air Tech
Google.description: The Grivel Anti Ball Plates are designed to prevent the build up of snow underneath the crampon and are an essential item for safety in snowy conditions.

Google.title: Winter Climbs - Ben Nevis and Glen Coe
Google.description: Ben Nevis, the peaks of Glen Coe and the surrounding mountains give some of the best snow and ice climbing anywhere in Europe, when the conditions are right. So popular and well known is Ben Nevis, that in recent years, climbers from as far afield as Poland, Australia, France, Italy and the USA have been seen trudging the delights of the 'famous' Allt a'Mhuilinn approach. Hamish MacInnes and Yvon Chouinard have made films of winter climbing on Ben Nevis, as have French guides, who continue to bring clients back each year. Justifiably a good 'tick' on any discerning world traveller's itinerary. Many of the routes are longer than experienced anywhere else in British hills and of alpine-like seriousness. It is not a good idea to be lured onto the famous 'Tower Ridge' of Ben Nevis as your first Scottish winter climb! This new full-colour edition has over 700 routes, including the best of the new routes up to the 2002 season. The guide covers Ben Nevis, Carn Dearg, Aonachs Mor and Beag, and Bidean nam Bian, Buchaille Etive Mor and outlying peaks in Glencoe.

Google.title: The Cairgorms - SMC Guide
Google.description: Arguably the definitive guidebooks to climbing in Scotland, the SMC books fom a series of clear and easy to use guides for the key climbing areas, all in a handy, pocket sized, laminated paperback. The Cairngorms guide is a fully comprehensive guide covering all of the summer and winter climbing in both the northern and southern Cairngorms area. With updated routes and clearer diagrams, it surpasses the seperate volumes that it replaced.

Google.title: Wanderfreund Speedlock
Google.description: The Leki Wanderfreund SpeedLock offers that bit of extra support when you're out and about, giving you the confidence to get off the beaten track. Supplied as a single pole, it's designed to be used when you can't fully rely on your feet - on uneven surfaces and to support a minor injury. The AergonMed grip is the biggest difference between this and other trekking poles. Made in an inverted 'L' shape, it's ideal for weighting from directly above, but can also be held round the neck for ascents. Tough plastic with cushioning rubber keep it sturdy but comfortable throughout the day. And SpeedLock adjusters make the Wanderfreund quick and easy to lengthen or pack away. A technical pole to give the support you need, grab your Wanderfreund and get going outdoors.

Google.title: Instructor Nordic
Google.description: Leki Instructor Nordic Walking poles are the top adjustable poles of their range, with a carbon lower section and Shark grip for maximum comfort in use. They're made for heavy users - instructors and frequent walkers, as the carbon lower shaft absorbs shock better than aluminium. There's also a cork grip to keep your fingers dry and blister-free on every trip. The Trigger Shark attachment makes for easy detachment too; simply push the button and the loop slides straight off. Designed for all-out performance and comfort on the move, this is a top-end pole for the serious Nordic walker. LEKI Nordic Walking Poles are slightly modified versions of their world-famous trekking poles. All poles feature a narrow profile "cross country"-style grip with the Adjustable/Releasable Trigger Strap. Shafts are composed of expedition-grade aluminium or light weight, rigid carbon. All poles feature Carbide Tips, removable Rubber Fitness Walking Tips and Baskets.

Google.title: Spin Nordic
Google.description: Nordic Walking began as a summer training exercise for serious "cross country" skiers. Fitness walkers in Europe adopted Nordic Walking as a time-efficient, low-stress, total body workout. LEKI Nordic Walking Poles are slightly modified versions of their world-famous trekking poles. All poles feature a narrow profile "cross country"-style grip with the Adjustable/Releasable Trigger Strap. Shafts are composed of expedition-grade aluminium or light weight, rigid carbon. All poles feature Carbide Tips, removable Rubber Fitness Walking Tips and Baskets.

Google.title: RidgeRest SOLite Regular
Google.description: The Thermarest RidgeRest SOLite mat makes a great extra insulation layer under your self-inflating mat, but is also surprisingly warm on its own. ThermaCapture technology (the silver layer) works with the heat-trapping ridged structure to retain significantly more of your body heat than your average closed-cell foam mat. In fact, it does this well enough to be a very lightweight option for three-season use. And because it won't absorb moisture, it's happy on the outside of your pack, leaving you more room inside. Go anywhere and sleep on anything with the Thermarest RidgeRest.

Google.title: Universal Couple Kit
Google.description: The Thermarest Universal Couple Kit eliminates that annoying (and chilly) gap between your mattress and that of your partner when snuggling in a tent. A pair of smartly designed straps that fit round both mattresses top and bottom, keeping them perfectly aligned and together all night. Large enough for all but the very largest, thickest mats (Size XXL MondoKings etc), the ladder buckles are adjustable so even two very different mats can be securely attached together. Extra comfort, less heat loss and no more ending up in a heap at the end of your tent. All from two easy-to-use straps in their own compact case. The Universal Couple Kit makes all the difference for couples living under canvas.

Google.title: Hubba and Hubba HP Footprint
Google.description: The MSR Hubba HP Footprint protects your inner tent floor from sharp objects and muck, but also adds versatility to your MSR Hubba HP tent. Tough, PU-coated polyester adds an extra layer of protection from water seepage, with a hydrostatic head of 2000mm and a DWR coating. But the whole thing still only weighs 140 grams and packs to a minimal size in its own storage bag. It's shaped to fit perfectly under the inner tent, held in place with elastic loops. Which leads us on to the other major benefit - the option to pitch the flysheet over the footprint only for a seriously fast and light shelter. It's a small investment that makes a big difference to the life and useability of your tent - no MSR Hubba HP tent should be without one!

Google.title: Quick Solo System
Google.description: The MSR Quick Solo System is the compact cookware set for solo travellers - just add cutlery and you've all the gear you need to eat a simple meal. Made from hard-anodised aluminium to keep the weight down, the 1.3 litre pan features a smart lid with a rubber handle and holes for straining. What's more, it's sized for the MSR Insulated mug to fit snugly inside. And the equally smart Talon pan handle secures the set together compactly in your pack. Well-designed, durable and pleasant to use, the Quick Solo Set is perfect for boiling water for your wet or dry expedition food.

Google.title: Quick Solo Pot
Google.description: The MSR Quick Solo Pot is all the pan you need for boiling water and heating simple foods on lightweight trips. 1.3-litre capacity is plenty for heating a meal pouch or making up dehydrated food, while the Talon handle makes manoeuvring the hot pan and its contents a breeze. Then when you're done just chuck your minimal eating kit inside for a compact package that weighs a tiny amount. A great workhorse pan for when lightweight simplicity is everything.

Google.title: Quick Solo Pot

Then when you're done just chuck your minimal eating kit inside for a compact package that weighs a tiny amount. A great workhorse pan for when lightweight simplicity is everything.

Google.title: Quick Skillet
Google.description: The MSR Quick Skillet adds that last bit of versatility to your lightweight cooking system, giving the option of frying without taking much extra space. Made from hard-anodised, non-stick aluminium it spreads heat to help reduce burning and is easy to clean afterwards. It's sized to fit snugly on the outside of an MSR 2.5 litre pot like that of the Quick 2 System, so the overall extra space required is minimal. Plus there's the added benefit of the folding Talon handle, making tossing, stabilising and moving the Quick Skillet unnoticeably easy. A major extension of your options with only a small increase in space - the Quick Skillet is the finishing touch to your arsenal for straightforward trail cooking.

Google.title: Alpinist 2 System
Google.description: The MSR Alpinist 2 System minimises the weight and packspace of cooking for two, with plates and mugs that pack into a lightweight pan. Designed for simple duties like boiling water, melting snow and heating simple meals in remote locations, the 2.4-litre pan holds plenty for two and will spread heat to help avoid burning. Inside, you can fit a DeepDish Plate and Insulated Mug each - these smartly-designed pieces fit perfectly to use the space efficiently as well as making eating off your knees as easy as it can be. There's even room enough for a third mug or a compact stove if space is at a premium. A compact cookset that won't bust the weight budget, the Alpinist 2 System is your all-in-one eating solution for lightweight trips.

Google.title: Universal Canister Stand
Google.description: The MSR Universal Canister Stand literally fits gas canisters of almost any size, giving your stove a stable base for cooking. Lightweight and verycompact, it's nevertheless strong enough for pans full of water. It's well-designed too, the spring-loaded holder on one leg allows easy removal as well as insertion of the canister. The long legs make a wide base so your dinner is safe even in breezy conditions.

Google.title: Alpine Deluxe Kitchen Set
Google.description: The MSR Alpine Deluxe Kitchen Set gives you all the tools you need to make a vast range of meals when base-camping, in a seriously compact case. Everything from folding utensils to a super-fast-drying, compact dish towel, including the essential bottle opener-corkscrew combo, is contained in the smart, semi-hard shell zipped case. There's even a straight-ended knife with a plastic sheath for safety. Each tool has been engineered and honed to practical perfection so it's about as close to your home cooking equipment as is sensible. A winner when cooking for groups and on road trips.

Google.title: Alpine Kitchen Set
Google.description: The MSR Alpine Kitchen Set keeps your camp cooking essentials together and compact; a practical package for proper cooking on the trail. Folding alpine-style utensils and a bendable, lightweight chopping board provide much of the utility of this cook's friend. Accessorised with squeeze bottles for oil and soap, a condiment shaker and quick-drying tea-towel, you're set for even quite complex meals with the addition of your penknife. Best of all, the whole lot rolls up in the lightweight fabric case. About the best way to keep your cooking gear under control when it goes in your pack every day, the Alpine Kitchen Set makes a big difference to cooking out of doors.

About the best way to keep your cooking gear under control when it goes in your pack every day, the Alpine Kitchen Set makes a big difference to cooking out of doors.

Google.title: Alpine Kitchen Set
Google.description: The MSR Alpine Kitchen Set keeps your camp cooking essentials together and compact; a practical package for proper cooking on the trail. Folding alpine-style utensils and a bendable, lightweight chopping board provide much of the utility of this cook's friend. Accessorised with squeeze bottles for oil and soap, a condiment shaker and quick-drying tea-towel, you're set for even quite complex meals with the addition of your penknife. Best of all, the whole lot rolls up in the lightweight fabric case. About the best way to keep your cooking gear under control when it goes in your pack every day, the Alpine Kitchen Set makes a big difference to cooking out of doors.

Google.title: Alpine Salt & Pepper Shaker
Google.description: The MSR Salt and Pepper Shaker will surprise you - it's remarkable how much difference such a small item can make. Very compact and designed to be easy to use, this little hero carries the critical condiments in sealed, separate containers. Whilst you fill it by removing the tight-fitting cap from the end, getting a bit out to add to food is simple with the flip tops. But not so simple that they'll come undone in transit. It's amazing how much effort MSR have put in to making this small essential perfect for proper cooking on the move.

Google.title: Lightning Axis 30
Google.description: Packed with MSR's latest technologies, the Lightning Axis snowshoes represent a giant leap in snowshoeing performance, ease and comfort. First, MSR's new Axis Gait Efficiency system allows you to laterally adjust bindings independently of the frame, ensuring efficient, parallel-tracking snowshoes, regardless of natural toe-out and toe-in stances. In addition, new SpeedLock bindings offer set-it and forget-it simplicity with all-terrain comfort, while new Ergo Televators save you on the steeps. And of course, you get the benefit of MSR's most aggressive, 360 Traction frames and Modular Flotation tails to provide you with the confidence and versatility you want to enjoy broad range of snowshoeing experiences.

Google.title: Evo Tour 22
Google.description: Evo Tour snowshoes combine a versatile foundation of Unibody traction with our latest, comfort-driven SpeedLock bindings for uncompromised performance across a broad range of experiences. Unibody decks have the tenacity to pull you through everything from crust to slush with in-molded brake bars and steel traction rails, while optional Modular Flotation tails assure unlimited access to all of winter. On the top side you'll find our new SpeedLock bindings with set-it-and-forget-it simplicity, comfort and control, plus Televator heel lifts ready to help you when the going gets up.

Google.title: G22 Cramp O Matic
Google.description: A well known system which relies on a nylon speed lever in the rear and a stainless steel front bale to hold the boot. Quick to put on, these bindings are perfect for plastic mountaineering boots that have a rigid sole and substantial heel and toe welts. The stainless steel safety strap, which was invented by Grivel, is permanently mounted on the front bale and prevents total loss of the crampon should it be forced off the boot. For information on the Grivel Range of Use, Click Here > Hide

Google.title: Boa HMS Locksafe
Google.description: This is the 'Big Daddy' of lockers - the ultimate rigging biner and one which is super strong and super tough. It is large enough to accommodate several knots and has a very wide gate opening - just what you need in a rigging situation. All of which makes it a great centre use biner, but the story doesn't end there. Despite its name, the Boa is surprisingly light; by giving it an I-Beam construction DMM have reduced the overall weight by almost 25%. Add in the fact that it is easy to handle in gloves and the appeal to winter climbers is obvious.

Google.title: Jetboil Sol Titanium
Google.description: The new Jetboil Sol is an ultra-compact cooking system using Jetboil's familiar PCS canister cooking technology. This version includes a titanium cup which saves an additional 40g with a weight of just 260g. Boil time for 0.5 litres of water is identical to the previous version at 2 minutes for both versions (aluminium cup version also available) as is the 12 liters of water boiled per 100g Jetpower fuel canister. So basically more of the same, but lighter and smaller.

Google.title: * Helios
Google.description: High performance meets high capacity with the Jetboil Helios cooking system. Incorporating the same FluxRing technology that launched the award-winning, best-selling PCS, Jetboil has scaled up and combined the PCS' benefits with inverted butane canister injection to create the easiest to use, most efficient, high capacity system available for outdoor cooking. Helios lights quickly and reliably with the click of a button, and heats consistently down to the last drop of fuel. Helios is an all-in-one cooking system that covers the gamut, from melting snow to prepping robust meals for you and your crew.

Google.title: Sol Titanium Companion Cup
Google.description: Added expandability for the Jetboil Sol or Zip cooking systems; the 0.8 liter Jetboil Sol Titanium FluxRing Companion Cup maximizes performance to weight. At just 6 ounces and delivering over 70% heating efficiency, Sol Titanium offers the ultimate lightweight cooking solution.

Google.title: Sol Aluminium Companion Cup

Google.title: Sol Aluminium Companion Cup

Google.title: Fold Dry Bag Ultralite XXS
Google.description: If you are travelling light and need your kit to stay reliably dry then the Exped Fold Dry Bag Ultralite XXSmall is definitely the way to go. As the name suggests, the dry bag serves to keep everything inside safe from the elements; all you need to do is fill it up with your clothes, food etc. then roll the top over three times and clip it together to make the bag airtight and fully waterproof, thus protecting all its contents. The 15 Denier Ripstop Nylon fabric is waterproof and extremely lightweight but still provides reliable protection so you can push harder through all weathers knowing your warm clothes will still be dry at the end of the day. The lightweight dry bag series comes in varying colours for each size, making it easy to organise your kit within your rucksack. If you've ever spent a night in a soggy sleeping bag or lost a camera to the elements, you'll know the true value of one of these wonders.

Google.title: SynMat 7 Pump M (STD)
Google.description: The Exped Synmat 7 M is an exceptionally warm, comfortable and compact mat that using synthetic microfibre insulation, making it superior to standard sleeping mats. The microfibre filled chambers are stable and comfy with the insulation bonded to the upper and lower surfaces of the mat so that as the mat is inflated it opens out the insulation and avoids the lofting problems that occur with synthetic sleeping bags. This coupled with the brushed polyester top fabric, providing excellent slip resistance and comfort next to the skin, guarantees a good nights sleep. The integrated pump is easily operated and will fill the mat within a few minutes, using two wide valves to ensure fast inflation to its 7 cm depth. Warmer and more packable than a foam filled self inflating mat, the inflated Synmats are thicker than normal self inflating mats but slimmer than an air bed.

Google.title: DownMat 7 Pump M (STD)
Google.description: The Exped Downmat 7 Pump is a 7cm thick sleeping mat that contains premium Goose Down to provide superb insulation from the cold ground. To inflate the mat use the built in pump, and not your own breath as this will be damp and effect the loft of the internal down. The pump is easily operated and fills the mat in a few minutes. The two wide valves ensure fast inflation and simple deflation. Similar to a sleeping bag, baffles between the mat's chambers eliminate cold spots and promote a stable and supportive air cushion. Light foam blocks at the mat's ends prevent down from escaping or migrating between chambers. Laminated polyester fabric is both durable and airtight. The top surface of honeycomb textured fabric provides superior slip resistance and comfort next to the skin. Seams and valves are all high-frequency welded (most secure method of fusing fabrics and materials) to ensure mat durability and integrity.

Google.title: Hyper Flow Cap
Google.description: The Platypus HyperFlow Cap fits any Platypus threaded neck, transforming any Platypus bottle into a fast-access hydration pouch. A step up from the average sports bottle, a soft Platypus bottle is the ultimate in thirst-quenching performance. Not only do you get full flow as soon as you squeeze the HyperFlow Bite valve, but you can squeeze the bottle to get that full flow without even sucking. It's the perfect conversion for runners, bikers and anyone else who regularly needs plenty of water fast.

Google.title: Closure Cap
Google.description: The Platypus Closure Cap is a simple screw top for any Platypus bottle or hydration system. An ideal back-up or replacement, it weighs almost nothing but allows storage of your water and swopping of caps when you're on the trail.

Google.title: Fuel Bottle Exped Cap
Google.description: An MSR Expedition Fuel Bottle Cap is the lightweight, quick and simple option for expedition use, keeping your bottle well-sealed and quick to open. Compatible with all MSR fuel bottles, it's particularly suited to use when wearing gloves.

Google.title: Fuel Bottle Exped Cap

Google.title: Alpine Plate
Google.description: This versatile, lightweight and strong seven and half inch diameter The MSR Alpine Plate takes durable practicality to extremes for all types of camping - virtually indestructible but still pleasant to eat from. Brushed stainless steel not only looks smart for longer, it also feels good and is exceptionally durable as well as easy to clean (ie scrubbable). You could even use it to gently heat food. The rounded bottom design is also multi-purpose - keeping your food safely in its depths, the shape allows several plates to nest compactly together alone or inside 2- or 3-litre MSR Alpine pans as in the Alpine 2 Pot Set. And best of all, they'll last through heavy use in even extreme conditions. Tough doesn't come looking much better than this.

Google.title: Alpine Plate
Google.description: This versatile, lightweight and strong seven and half inch diameter The MSR Alpine Plate takes durable practicality to extremes for all types of camping - virtually indestructible but still pleasant to eat from. Brushed stainless steel not only looks smart for longer, it also feels good and is exceptionally durable as well as easy to clean (ie scrubbable). You could even use it to gently heat food. The rounded bottom design is also multi-purpose - keeping your food safely in its depths, the shape allows several plates to nest compactly together alone or inside 2- or 3-litre MSR Alpine pans as in the Alpine 2 Pot Set. And best of all, they'll last through heavy use in even extreme conditions. Tough doesn't come looking much better than this.

Google.title: LiteLifter Pot Lifter
Google.description: Weighing only 1 ounce, MSR's aluminum LiteLifter safely lifts 4-liter pots of liquid. Ideal for use with MSR's Titan product family--which includes Kettle, Cup, Cook Set, and Pots. All of which are ultra-lightweight and half the weight of stainless steel.

Google.title: LiteLifter Pot Lifter
Google.description: Weighing only 1 ounce, MSR's aluminum LiteLifter safely lifts 4-liter pots of liquid. Ideal for use with MSR's Titan product family--which includes Kettle, Cup, Cook Set, and Pots. All of which are ultra-lightweight and half the weight of stainless steel.

Google.title: Field Compass
Google.description: The Silva Field Compass demonstrates that straightforward can still be fully functional when it comes to a high quality compass. The small baseplate of the Field Compass is ideal for D of E and group use, as a first compass for smaller hands or for those travelling fast and light. That's not to say it's short on features though: you still get measurement scales in mm, 1:25,000 and 1:50,000 making it compatible with all the Ordnance Survey Explorer and Landranger series maps. It's easy to use too, thanks to the DryFlex rubber grip around the bezel; and hard to lose, with a detachable safety-release lanyard. When what you need is reliable direction-finding, you'll be well served by a Silva Field Compass.

Google.title: Ranger Compass
Google.description: Everything you need in a compass with Silva's high-quality design and build, the Ranger Compass is ideal for any outdoor navigation, including D of E. Traditionally sized base-plate design, with a magnifying lens for detailed maps, will keep mountaineers and backpackers happy on the trail, plus there's night-luminous marking and a rubberised bezel making the Ranger easy to use at any time, in any weather. The Ranger has scales for 1:25,000 and 1:50,000 mapping as well as a millimetre scale, making it versatile and useful for the UK and most countries abroad. Additionally, there's a declination scale built into the capsule, allowing you to measure the angle of a slope to a reasonable degree of accuracy - very helpful in checking or finding where you are. This comprehensive package is completed with a removeable safety lanyard to hang it round your neck or inside a pocket and help avoid losing it, particularly in snow. For reliable direction-finding in a straightforward and robust design, any outdoor navigator will find the Ranger ideal for their purpose.

Google.title: ! Mountaineering in the Moroccan High Atlas
Google.description: The first English-language guide to winter walking, climbing, scrambling right across the Moroccan High Atlas of North Africa from Taroudant in the south-west to Midelt in the north-east, all accessible from Marrakech. Covers 40 peaks over 3000m, including Jbel Toubkal, Ighil Mgoun, Jbel Tinergwet. For experienced winter walkers.

Google.title: The Munros - SMC guide
Google.description: This 2006 revised reprint of the best selling guidebook to the Munros contains a completely new set of maps, which as well as showing the Munros and Munro Tops will also show all of the neighbouring Corbetts, Corbett Tops, Grahams and Graham Tops. In addition to extensive text amendments, the images throughout the book are enhanced and there are a number of new images, including the cover. This is the definitive hillwalkers' guidebook to the Munros, compiled by the Scottish Mountaineering Trust on behalf of the Scottish Mountaineering Club.

Google.title: 11mm Apollo 60m Dry Cover

Google.title: Cote dAzur Rockfax
Google.description: The cliffs of the South of France rocketed to popularity back in the 1980s when it was realised what great climbing was available and how good the weather was down there. Since then other areas have attracted the attention of travelling climbers and once-popular venues such as the cliffs of the Calanques, Sainte Victoire and even the Verdon have rather fallen off the radar in recent years. Following from the recent well received France : Haute Provence guidebook, France : Cte d'Azur reassesses these famous cliffs and also includes some of the great venues around Toulon, the sunniest city in France. Plus there is the popular winter venue of Chteauvert, the less well known Esterel and Chteaudouble areas, as well as the world famous Verdon Gorge. Add in Saint Jeannet and a selection of cliffs in the Nice area and this will become an essential volume for any climber. Presented in the universally-praised Rockfax style, the book gives the reader with clear landscape photos of each crag, never-before-seen close-up photo-topos, and a wealth of action photos taken specifically for the book. Whether you're planning your trip from home, or choosing your next route at the crag, this guide has everything you're looking for.

Google.title: Safety on Mountains BMC
Google.description: For new and experienced walkers alike, Safety on Mountains is packed with advice. Whether planning a short summer walk or a multi-day winter trip, Safety on Mountains highlights the essentials skills and techniques. Safety on Mountains has been in print for over thirty years; this new edition is packed with up to date information and advice, making it the perfect hill walker's handbook.

Google.title: FireSteel 2 Army
Google.description: The Swedish Firesteel, you will probably have seen these used on TV by bushcraft presenters. This is the Army model. The New and Improved Firesteel 2.0 is the Ultimate way to Light a Fire! Originally developed by the Swedish Defence Department its 3,000C spark makes Fire Building Easy - Even in Wet and Cold Conditions and at any Altitude. The Swedish FireSteel's Dependability has made it a firm favourite amongst both Survival and Bushcraft Enthusiasts... It has also found its way into cabins and backyards as a fool-proof way to light stoves and gas-barbecues. The Swedish Firesteel 2.0 features an all new design with an improved striker and emergency whistle built into the striker handle...

Google.title: Moroccan Atlas Trekking Guide
Google.description: The Moroccan Atlas stretches 2000km from the Atlantic port of Agadir east to Tunisia and forms one of the world's great trekking destinations - the high Atlas region in central Morocco being the most dramatic in the entire range. Google.title: Sumo Titanium
Google.description: Jetboils are great for one-person-at-a-time cooking. Now there's the Sumo, a 1.8-liter cook pot that locks onto your Jetboil burner base. This coffee can shaped billy melts snow like a pro, great for high-altitude excursions. Despite its larger size and weight, it's not a gas hog, and you can fit a complete Jetboil system inside for packing purposes. Insulated by neoprene, the bottom cover doubles as a measuring cup and bowl.

Google.title: Sumo Companion Bowl Set
Google.description: The compact and lightweight 3-piece Jetboil Sumo Companion Bowl Set nests invisibly inside any Jetboil Sumo cooking vessel along with all Sumo system components, adding a total of 1.8 liters of serving capacity and completing the ideal backcountry kitchen. Sumo bowl set packs easily in Sumo systems with a 100 or 230 gram fuel, burner base, pot support and stabilizer.

Google.title: Chocolate Pudding

Google.title: Double Spring Leash
Google.description: The Grivel Double Spring Leash combines value and performance to ensure you won't be disappointed. There's no chance of losing your ice axe with the Double Spring Leash, this product leaving your hands free due to its elastic double sling system that avoids tools from dropping when on the rocks or ice. It solves the problem of modern climbing without a leash, and is fully adjustable so as to be as compact or indeed long as you require. The Grivel Double Spring Leash is a great little investment for making sure you won't lose your axes and similar tools when climbing.

Google.title: Single Spring Leash with Rotor Crab
Google.description: An elastic sling system to avoid losing tools when climbing on rock or ice. This solves the problem for climbers who love climbing without a leash. The Single Spring is attached to the harness by looping it through the tape ring over the harness itself. The small carabiner is hooked onto the hole on the axe's head when using it to lean on when walking or through the hole on the spike when holding the shaft in traction. In both cases it is impossible to lose the axe. The system allows the climber to swap hands or tool easily without interfering with the manoeuvre thanks to it compactness and the arm can be extended to its limit thanks to its elasticity. Compact when required, long when required.

Google.title: Expedition 4
Google.description: The Silva Expedition 4 Compass has everything an experienced navigator could want in a baseplate compass, plus it's light, tough and fits in your pocket. There's barely a map that the Expedition 4 can't measure, with mm, inches, 1:50k, 1:25k, 1:40k and romer scales for GPS users all included on the large baseplate. A stencil hole and luminous markings further increase versatility, adding orienteering and night navigation to the list of activities that it's ideal for. This Silva compass is not only full of features, it's also easy to use, with three silicone feet to hold it in place on your map and a large magnifier for those busy, detailed areas. Supplied with an instruction leaflet and a lanyard to attach it to your map case or in a pocket, the Silva Expedition 4 is your indispensible friend for UK navigation during almost any activity.

Google.title: Winter Climbs Lake District
Google.description: The two previous versions of this guide showed the potential of the region for winter climbing. With improvements in ice tools the last decade has seen an explosion in mixed buttress routes, confirming the area as a major winter climbing venue.

Google.title: ! Ridges of Snowdonia - Ashton
Google.description: This guide brings together the best ridge walks in Snowdonia. In describing them the author has tried to be both readable and accurate, which should help to explain the unusual layout. The raw material of the route - map, information, route description - is presented in four no-frills pages, while the general chit-chat and photographs are allowed to follow on at their leisure. This means you have the option to glance through one or the other according to need, and without having to plough through an unnecessary amount of verbiage. Because the book is designed primarily for the hill-walking enthusiast, the author has commandeered space traditionally reserved for introductory notes and lengthy topographical descriptions (using photographs to help compensate in this latter respect) in order to explore the hill-walking experience beyond what is normally possible in a guidebook.

Google.title: ! Treks In Dolomites Alte Vie 1&2
Google.description: Situated toward the eastern end of the Alps' great curve from the Mediterranean coast through central Europe to the Balkans, the Dolomites region occupies a large area of northern Italy. A dense network of footpaths there offers endless scope forexhilarating high-level walks; the renowned "vie ferrate" (rock routes aided by fixed metal ladders and cables) lead up into many sensational situations, while in winter the region becomes a premier skiing destination

Google.title: ! Treks In Dolomites Alte Vie 1&2
Google.description: Situated toward the eastern end of the Alps' great curve from the Mediterranean coast through central Europe to the Balkans, the Dolomites region occupies a large area of northern Italy. A dense network of footpaths there offers endless scope forexhilarating high-level walks; the renowned "vie ferrate" (rock routes aided by fixed metal ladders and cables) lead up into many sensational situations, while in winter the region becomes a premier skiing destination

Google.title: Snowshoeing Mont Blanc/Western Alps
Google.description: For centuries people have used snowshoes as a means of travelling in deep snow, but only relatively recently has snowshoeing become an activity that people do for pleasure. Nowadays, visit any winter ski resort and you'll not only find crowds of people heading for the ski runs but also a considerable number setting out on snowshoes. This book aims to show the keen hill-walker what snowshoeing can offer if you can walk you can snowshoe! Equipped correctly, with reasonable knowledge of winter conditions and dangers, you can enjoy hiking in the winter in terrain that would otherwise be inaccessible on foot. The Mont Blanc region of the European Alps is the perfect destination for a snowshoeing holiday, be it at a beginner level or for those with more experience who seek the heady joys of summits and treks in winter. This guide not only selects some of the best walks, hikes and treks in the region, all more or less within sight of Mont Blanc (given a clear day, good eyesight and some imagination), but it will also prepare you for the experience. There are sections on equipment, technique, hazards, preparation and nature, as well as 70 outings, ranging from the very gentle to the particularly strenuous. Each walk description is accompanied by practical information, timings and grade, and the routes are illustrated on clear overview maps.

Google.title: Snowshoeing Mont Blanc/Western Alps
Google.description: For centuries people have used snowshoes as a means of travelling in deep snow, but only relatively recently has snowshoeing become an activity that people do for pleasure. Nowadays, visit any winter ski resort and you'll not only find crowds of people heading for the ski runs but also a considerable number setting out on snowshoes. This book aims to show the keen hill-walker what snowshoeing can offer if you can walk you can snowshoe! Equipped correctly, with reasonable knowledge of winter conditions and dangers, you can enjoy hiking in the winter in terrain that would otherwise be inaccessible on foot. The Mont Blanc region of the European Alps is the perfect destination for a snowshoeing holiday, be it at a beginner level or for those with more experience who seek the heady joys of summits and treks in winter. This guide not only selects some of the best walks, hikes and treks in the region, all more or less within sight of Mont Blanc (given a clear day, good eyesight and some imagination), but it will also prepare you for the experience. There are sections on equipment, technique, hazards, preparation and nature, as well as 70 outings, ranging from the very gentle to the particularly strenuous. Each walk description is accompanied by practical information, timings and grade, and the routes are illustrated on clear overview maps.

Google.title: Scrambles Lakes Vol 1 South
Google.description: It sometimes seems that there are no inviolate places remaining to the adventurer in the Lake District. But this is not quite the case. Scrambling - ascending rock that is not usually difficult or steep enough to warrent the term 'rock climbing' - can take you to many exiting places, many well removed from the beaten track. Even in popular areas of the Lake District, by combining several scrambles you can often hardly touch a path and rarely see other people at close quarters. A good long scramble with interesting route finding gives a very satisfying way of exploring England's Lake District.

Google.title: Scrambles Lakes Vol 2 North
Google.description: The second of a two-volume set of guides to scrambles in the Lake District. The set are based on 'Scrambles in the Lake District' and 'More Scrambles in the Lake District', two of the original scrambling guides to the Lake District by one of Britain's best-known climbers. Continually reprinted for 20 years these guides have now been fully updated and merged into two definitive guides, for southern and northern Lakes. (For details of 'Scrambles in the Lake District South', see below.) The Lake District's rich mix of rocks, gills and crags offers the scrambler a complex variety of routes, often well removed from the beaten track. Scrambling - ascending rock that is not usually difficult or steep enough to warrant the term 'rock climbing' - means you often hardly touch a path and rarely see other people at close quarters. This is a way of getting back to a wilder Lakeland and enjoying the freedom of rough mountain country.

Google.title: Navigation Mini Guide
Google.description: Part of Cicerone Press' new series of mini-guides covering essential skills for all outdoor enthusiasts, Navigation: Techniques and Skills for Walkers, by Pete Hawkins, is one of the first four mini-guides to be published. This practical guide will help you get the most out of your map and give you the key skills to using your compass. It's then down to you. As with any skill, knowledge isn't enough. Practice will make perfect, and with that will come the freedom and confidence to enjoy our hills and mountains.

Google.title: Dragonfly Stove
Google.description: The MSR DragonFly enables serious cooking on serious trips; for group use and base-camping the precision control makes elaborate cooking possible. Despite the low weight and packsize, the low suspended burner unit has wide pot supports to take large pans up to 10 inches in diameter. Highly stable, the included heat reflector and wind shield work with the dual valve adjustment for exceptional control of the output. Use it with white fuel, kerosene, unleaded petrol, diesel or jet fuel - the versatility is endless, with Shaker Jet technology keeping field maintenance easy. The ideal stove for those who don't like to be limited, the DragonFly pushes the limits of cooking on camp.

Google.title: Dragonfly Stove

Google.title: SuperFly with AutoStart
Google.description: The MSR SuperFly with AutoStart sits in the sweet spot for cooking on expedition; big enough to be controllable for cooking, but still lightweight. It's not short on power either, boiling a litre of water in around three minutes. And it's extremely versatile thanks to the Multi-Mount fitting that allows the SuperFly to run on almost any self-sealing canister you'll find. This version comes with the AutoStart Igniter for convenient start-up, though it is removable to save weight. Made to allow effective cooking of simple meals, the adjustable flame and wide burner head will make it possible to eat proper food on every trip. And the wide supports are great for large pots but twist away for packing. MSR's most versatile canister stove, the SuperFly makes eating easy on the trail.

Google.title: XGK EX Stove
Google.description: The MSR XGK EX stove is not self-conscious in any way - almost obscenely powerful it's the most reliable multi-fuel stove ever built. It's designed to work in the places where other stoves just won't - in extreme cold, at altitude and where regular fuels aren't available. The XGK EX can be used with diesel, unleaded petrol, kerosene, jet fuel and aviation fuel as well as the cleaner white gas, so you'll never be stuck for a means of cooking your dinner. It's built to last too, the rugged, highly stable construction and unique fuel delivery system ensuring a long life with fewer clogs. The ultimate in snow-melting, water-boiling efficiency, the XGK EX won't be beaten on all-round toughness.

Google.title: Trillium Stove Base
Google.description: The MSR Trillium Stove Base stabilises any remote canister or multi-fuel stove on softer surfaces as well as reflecting some heat back into your food. Particularly useful for snow, gravel and sand, the Trillium folds away into a compact, flat shape that will fit in the bag with your stove or in a 2L MSR pot. Plus it weighs just 80 grams, making it a valuable item on any winter camping kit list.

Google.title: XGK EX Expedition Service Kit
Google.description: The MSR XGK EX Expedition Kit has the spare parts you need as backup on remote trips when a broken stove could be life-threatening. Specialised for the XGK EX stove, the kit contains all those little bits that could go missing or wrong on your trip along with maintenance equipment, all conveniently packed in a compact clip case. Weighing only 113g, it's a small item that makes a big difference when you really need it.

Google.title: Titan Kettle
Google.description: An MSR Titan Kettle is the one multi-functional item to do all your cooking on a weight budget. Though it's seriously lightweight at only 118g, it's a remarkably flexible pot - cook in it, eat from it, boil water in it and even drink from it. A folding wire handle facilitates moving the kettle around while hot, but won't take up extra space in your minimal kitbag. There's even an efficient little spout, making pouring easier without making packing hard. And the snugly-sealing lid keeps your fuel requirement to a minimum. Made for those ultra-lightweight trips when every gram is considered and simplicity is king, the Titan Kettle rules the lightweight roost for heating and eating pre-packed food.

Google.title: Solid Heat Reflector and Windscreen
Google.description: The MSR Solid Heat Reflector and Windscreen increase the stability of your remote-burning stove and decrease boiling times, but fold up small and light for packing. The Heat Reflector base makes a solid platform for your stove on surfaces like snow, sand and gravel, while bouncing heat back into your food that would otherwise be wasted. Meanwhile, the foil Windscreen shields your cookset from wind without restricting airflow to the burner. Then simply fold them up into a minimal package that you will be happy to take everywhere your stove goes.

Google.title: Standard Fuel Pump
Google.description: The MSR Standard Fuel Pump is a replacement part that fits all MSR multi-fuel stoves except the DragonFly. Extremely strong and durable thanks to its fibreglass reinforcement, this latest interation also has a smart valve design which improves flame control, while the seal is more reliable. Can be used to upgrade older stoves to increase performance or to replace worn parts and avoid replacing the whole stove.

Google.title: Snow Picket 60cm

Google.title: Fifi Hook
Google.description: Black Diamond's Fifi Hook is a quick and easy to use tool designed for aid climbing. This simple bit of gear is invaluable to aid climbers and key to any arsenal for assaulting a big wall due to its ease of use; simply weight the hook and look to continuing up. The Fifi Hook has a large hole at the bottom for connecting to your harness and a smaller hole at the top for connecting a retrieval cord. It's basic function is to hook into gear and take your weight. Please note that the Fifi Hook offers very little strength compared to a locking carabiner and, due to its open shape, requires a great deal of care when used.

Google.title: Dynex Daisy Chain 18mm x 115cm
Google.description: A Black Diamond Dynex Daisy Chain 140cm makes clipping in to belays and anchors a cinch on big walls and multi-pitch climbs. Tightly woven for a reassuringly stiff feel, the abrasion-resistant Dynex material weighs a minimal 43g and folds very small for transport. It's also handy in use thanks to the half-twists in the endloops that let it lie neatly when lark's footed into your belay loop. Instant length adjustment at seriously low weight, just remember to reverse-clip the endloop as well as a pocket for full strength in a fall.

Tightly woven for a reassuringly stiff feel, the abrasion-resistant Dynex material weighs a minimal 43g and folds very small for transport. It's also handy in use thanks to the half-twists in the endloops that let it lie neatly when lark's footed into your belay loop. Instant length adjustment at seriously low weight, just remember to reverse-clip the endloop as well as a pocket for full strength in a fall.

Google.title: Superslacker
Google.description: The Black Diamond Superslacker is a traditional, reliable rope bag with a courier-style shoulder strap and fold out tarp to protect your rope. Once easily carried to the crag, simply unsinch the drawcord closure at either end, undo the full zip and roll out the rope - for better rope management, tie either end to the provided loops on the bag. The intuitively designed but simplistic Superslacker allows you to keep your rope clean and tangle free and provides ample room for you to flake your rope onto, whilst the 420 Denier packcloth is tough enough that durability isn't a worry.

Google.title: Deploy 3 Shovel
Google.description: Check out the Black Diamond Deploy 3 Shovel if you want a design that's light, small, fast, and simple. The Deploy 3 Shovel's handle collapses into the blade for a tiny 17.3in package that's entirely self-contained. Just give the handle a pull, and its trapezoidal shape ensures it slides and locks into place. No more messing with frozen buttons or handle parts buried in your pack. In addition to this Black Diamond shovel's amazing simplicity, it weighs only 20oz, making it a great choice for alpine climbing and lightweight backcountry tours.

Google.title: Mosquito DuoNet Double
Google.description: Designed to fit comfortably over a double bed, each of these nets comes with a hanging kit and an extended skirt allowing you to tuck the net under a mattress or sleeping mat. The mesh of each net exceeds the World Health Organisation specification for quality of the mesh. Nets are available unimpregnated or impregnated with Permethrin; a substance safe to humans but harmful to biting insects. This acts as an extra layer of protection against being bitten.

Google.title: Mosquito UltraNet Single
Google.description: Weighing just 220g, the UltraNet is ideal for the minimalist traveller who is looking to save space and weight in their pack. Google.title: Fabric Wash
Google.description: Never run out of travel clothes again; with a bottle of Lifeventure Fabric Wash you can have clean laundry wherever you are, even without a sink. This useful flat bottle contains a concentrated formula that works anywhere from hotel sinks to remote streams. Requiring only a little bit for clean clothes with a lovely fresh smell, a single bottle lasts a surprising time for adventure travel and family camping. In fact it's so small and light that even long-distance backpackers and gap-year students won't begrudge it a little space for the benefits. Travel is more enjoyable when your clothes feel good and as Lifeventure Fabric Wash is safe for most fabrics you can't go wrong with a bottle in your bag.

Google.title: Survival whistle
Google.description: The world's most powerful whistle, made from a toughened plastic material, the Survival Whistle is an essential part of any outdoor or mountain survival kit. A whistle can be used to alert people if you are in distress. The internationally recognised distress signal is 6 blasts of the whistle with a 1 minute break and then repeated. The reply is 3 blasts with the same pause.

Google.title: Trangia 25/1 Cooker
Google.description: The Trangia 25/1 Cooker allows cooking for 3-4 people when backpacking or camping. They are excellent family stoves with capacious pans, a wider frypan and a larger kettle. With the supports in the raised position, the stove can be used with large billies from the rest of the Trangia range. All the stove systems in the 25 series have two saucepans (1.75 and 1.5 litres), a 22 cm frying pan, windshields (upper and lower), a burner, a pan grip and a strap.

Google.title: Aero Bent Gate

It is designed to work at the rope-clipping end of a quickdraw; the bent gate giving a quick and easy clip every time. It also has a large (26mm) gate opening and a clean nose design to reduce snagging.

Google.title: Tenacious Tape
Google.description: For Instant Repairs! Tenacious Brand repair tape is ideal for fast in-field repairs on tents, tarps, rain gear, fishing gear and more. Our super aggressive adhesive sticks to almost any surface and can be used for a variety of flexible, long lasting repairs. Our non-gloss finish is almost invisible, eliminating the need to match colors on fabrics and other materials. Instantly seals leaking seams, tears and pinholes, stops rips from spreading and acts as an abrasion-resistant shield on high-wear areas. Can be used in conjunction with McNett Urethane Adhesives for ultra strong repairs.

Google.title: Survival Bag 36" x 78"
Google.description: This Dalesman survival bag is lightweight and waterproof and large enough to fit a sleeping bag as well as your gear. You never know when you might need it, it could really make the difference.

Google.title: Silnet 28ml
Google.description: Specially formulated for sealing seams on tents and other outdoor products constructed or coated with silicone, such as silicone treated nylon. Silnet may also be used as an in-field repair material for moderate rips, tears and areas of abrasion.

Google.title: Haute Route
Google.description: "The guidebook covers the Classic Route, six main variations (both for walking and skiing), many additional minor route options, and the main mountains."

Google.title: Haute Route

Google.title: * Desert Rock
Google.description: Largely short routes up Incredible accesible cacks including Wall Street, Long Canyon and the Potash Road near Moab, Utah.

Google.title: * Desert Rock
Google.description: Largely short routes up Incredible accesible cacks including Wall Street, Long Canyon and the Potash Road near Moab, Utah.

Google.title: Navigation for Walkers 2nd Edition
Google.description: Navigation for Walkers is an easy to follow instruction book on how to fully understand and use maps, and the freedom this gives to navigate and complete any walk in the British countryside. Profusely illustrated in colour with 50 linked pairs of landscape photographs together with their exact map extract alongside. If you are at all apprehensive about taking the first steps exploring the countryside around you, then 'Navigation for Walkers' will certainly start you on the right path to aquiring the skills to navigate and complete any walk in Britain. Only with a good understanding of maps and by using them correctly can any walker truly experience the quiet exhilaration and freedom of walking centuries old paths, bridle and green lanes which make up the thousands of miles of public rights of way that criss-cross Britain's uniquely beautiful and often remote open countryside. Based on the Ordnance Survey's new Explorer maps, as well as the Outdoor Leisure and Landranger series, this book takes the reader step by step through the essential techniques of map reading, navigation skills, reading the compass and route planning. Julian Tippett has fifty years experience of route finding by map in the hills and moors of Britain; he teaches navigation skills and advises both the Ramblers' Association and the National Navigation Award Scheme.

Google.title: Mont Blanc Guide Vol 1 Alpine Club
Google.description: The Mont Blanc Massif provides the alpinist with some of the finest quality routes in Europe, whether it be along the delicate snow crests, on rough red granite, or steep ice. Provides a very wide selection of routes in all grades that will suit everyone from the novice to the experienced Alpinist and the dedicated rock climber who may have little or no interest in actually reaching summits.

Google.title: On Peak Rock
Google.description: The best selected climbs book yet published, although some failed to appreciate the grouping of crags (a formal index is on p412ff). Great intros, good selection of routes and coffee table quality photographs to make you reach for the car keys.

Google.title: Glencoe Rock & Ice SMC
Google.description: Glen Coe has long been in the forefront of high standard mountain routes and includes some of the hardest summer and winter routes in the country. Easily accessible for the majority of those living in Scotland. its rough lavas provide some of the most enjoyable rock climbing in the country at any grade and many of Scotland's classic winter routes are found here. A very comprehensive guide to the climbs as is to expected from the Scttish Mountaineering Council Areas covered:--- Buachaille Etive Mor, The Bidean nam Bian Massif, Glen Coe North, Glen Coe outliers, Glen Creran, Glen Etive, Ardgour, Ardnamurchan.

Google.title: Stanage BMC Guide
Google.description: A brand new development, and the first for British guidebooks, is a series of bouldering circuits, mapping out collections of problems at similar levels. Three of these circuits are centered around the Causeway/Counts/Plantation areas, and two around the Apparent North area.These will lead even the most jaded Stanage devotee to areas and problems they have never seen before, giving unique and tiring days out.

Google.title: ! Oberland Selected Climbs Alpine Club
Google.description: Bernese Oberland including Salbitschijen, selected climbs by Les Swindin.

Google.title: Eastern Alps Classic Routes
Google.description: A selection of snow routes on 55 of the highest peaks between eastern Switzerland and the Slovenian border. There is an introduction to each mountain group and individual descriptions for each summit ascent, climbing via a mountain hut. Layout diagrams show the climb areas and mark the routes to huts and the summits. Illustrated with both colour and black & white photographs.

Google.title: Mt Blanc Ski Tours
Google.description: This topo-guide presents and describes the main back-country routes in the Mont Blanc and Aiguilles Rouges Massifs, whether you start from Val Montjoie, the Chamonix Valley, Vallorcine or from the Swiss or Italian sides of Mont-Blanc.

Google.title: ! Northern Highlands North SMC Climbers Guide
Google.description: This guide is the first of a new three volume series covering the Northern Highlands and replacing the current Northern Highlands Vol 1 & 2. Northern Highlands North details climbs north of the Inverness - Ullapool road, including Orkney and Shetland, but excluding Ben Wyvis. The new three volume series reflects the massive development of rock climbing on the smaller and generally easier of access crags of the North-west. Northern Highlands North details hundreds of new routes in Caithness, North-west Sutherland, Assynt, Reiff and Coigach and on Orkney and Shetland.

Google.title: Clogwyn Dur Arddu New Edition CCG
Google.description: "A fully researched and rewritten guidebook to this most hallowed of cliffs. Although the author Nick Dixon is famed for his very hard first ascents and repeats, he has also sought to raise the profile of many of the easier classics"

Google.title: ! Cotswold Way (Harvey)
Google.description: Guide to the 102-mile Cotswold Way (National Trail) between Chipping Campden and Bath. The route is described in both directions. It meanders through the beautiful Cotswold landscape, visiting honey-coloured villages and old market towns, and ends in the World Heritage City of Bath.

Google.title: ! Cotswold Way (Harvey)
Google.description: Guide to the 102-mile Cotswold Way (National Trail) between Chipping Campden and Bath. The route is described in both directions. It meanders through the beautiful Cotswold landscape, visiting honey-coloured villages and old market towns, and ends in the World Heritage City of Bath.

Google.title: Peak District Bouldering
Google.description: A comprehensive guide to all the bouldering in the Peak District of England. 352 pages, hundreds of inspirational photos, consensus grades from Font 3 - 8b+, all the grit, the best of the limestone, hundreds of awesome new problems, lots of new areas, hidden gems, highballs, classic circuits, graded lists and more. The guide has been written by, and thoroughly researched with the help of people that live and breathe bouldering in the Peak. Like walking around with your perfect climbing partner in your bag, it will guide you to the crags like a well informed local, inspire you when you're alone with it in bed at night, provide good pub banter and it will be stunning eye candy as it sits on your coffee table.

Google.title: Scottish Rock Climbs SMC
Google.description: This guide details more than 1200 of Scotland's best rock climbs from Orkney to Galloway. Routes range across the grades, on many different rock types in a wide variety of locations from mountain cliffs and lowland crags, to sea-cliffs and sea-stacks. Supplementing the descriptions are 64 full colour photo-diagrams, 25 colour maps and plans, and more than 60 action photographs. If your need one guide to Scottish climbs; this is it!

Google.title: Aconcagua Summit of S America
Google.description: Of the seven summits, Aconcagua (at 6962 m/22,840 ft) lies second only to Everest. Yet it is surprisingly free of snow and ice, and experienced hikers can reach the roof of the Americas without technical expertise. However, it is one of the world's highest and toughest treks. Author Harry Kikstra has summited twice, and explains in detail how to tackle the main trekking routes (Normal and Polish Traverse), as well as giving a useful summary on the technical Polish Glacier route. This pocket-sized guidebook has a wraparound map flap, open-flat binding and waterproof paper. It contains all you need to plan and enjoy your summit attempt.

Google.title: Burbage Millstone and Beyond BMC
Google.description: "Covering, amongst others, the crags of Burbage, Higgar, Millstone. Lawrencefield, Rivelin, Bell Hagg, Wyming Brook, Bamford, Derwent Edge, Agden Rocher and Wharncliffe this truly is a bumper guide. It will detail all the routes and boulder problems to be "

Google.title: Burbage Millstone and Beyond BMC
Google.description: "Covering, amongst others, the crags of Burbage, Higgar, Millstone. Lawrencefield, Rivelin, Bell Hagg, Wyming Brook, Bamford, Derwent Edge, Agden Rocher and Wharncliffe this truly is a bumper guide. It will detail all the routes and boulder problems to be "

Google.title: Highland Scrambles North SMC
Google.description: A mountaineering/scrambling/climbing guidebook, this full colour guide details some of the best scrambles and easy rock climbs to be found in the North-West Highlands of Scotland and the Outer Isles. It covers this wild and spectacular area, which stretches from Sutherland in the north to Glen Shiel in the south, and from South Uist in the West to Caithness in the east. This companion guide to the highly successful "Skye Scrambles Guide" (090752155X) describes a large number of scrambles for the very first time. It includes 138 detailed route descriptions, of which over one third have not previously been documented. It features 75 specially commissioned Mark Hudson line art diagrams. With a PVC encapsulated softback cover, it comes in a slimline shape and size, ideal for pockets and rucksacks, and includes a page marker ribbon.

Google.title: St Gervais/Mt Blanc 3531 et
Google.description: Detailed, accurate, topographic 1:25 000 maps of France. These maps are ideal for the walker showing the smallest footpaths. They are the equivalent of the Ordnance Survey Pathfinder or Explorer maps. This map features the popular Mont Blanc area.

Google.title: Snowflake Baskets - Pair
Google.description: If you're walking, ski-touring or snowshoeing in deep powder snow, you need Leki Touring or Snowflake Baskets to keep your poles firmly on the surface. Adding nearly 10cm of width to spread pressure over a wider area, Touring Baskets use a snowflake design for efficiency of weight. Easy to fit and swop for trekking baskets, they make travelling in snow much easier, so you are free to enjoy the frozen scenery.

Google.title: Trekking Baskets
Google.description: Leki Trekking Baskets stop your poles from plunging into cracks and soft ground, keeping your poles and, more importantly, your shoulders safer. Adding 5cm of width at the top end of the tip, trekking baskets are big enough to prevent your poles sinking too far, but small enough to not get in your way when walking. Lightweight and practical, this replacement pair fit perfectly on all Leki trekking and ski poles.

Google.title: Hyperspace Footprint
Google.description: The Terra Nova Hyperspace Footprint provides more pitching options and a longer life for your tent, adding extra protection from wet ground and sharp objects. Shaped to fit precisely underneath the sleeping compartment of the Terra Nova Hyperspace tent, your groundsheet will thank you for laying out the Footprint before pitching. You'll see the other benefits after a night on muddy, wet ground when you pack up a clean, dry inner tent. The Footprint has its own storage sack that keeps it separate and compact in your pack... or on the outside when it's really mucky. A small addition that makes a big difference to the life of your tent; buy a Terra Nova Hyperspace Footprint to make a difference to your camping life too.

Google.title: Bothy Bag 2 Man
Google.description: The Terra Nova Bothy 2 is used by mountain leaders, rescue organisations, backcountry skiers and canoe guides all over the world, these indispensable lightweight emergency shelters allow the users to create a 'microclimate' that is warm and dry - perfect for map reading, group discussions or even as a morale-booster for wet lunch breaks. Bothy bags come in a range of sizes and feature clear windows, mesh vents and roof 'sockets' which can house walking poles for additional support.

Google.title: * Gaiter Stroll On One Size Navy
Google.description: An entry-level gaiter for the budget-conscious walker, the Outdoor Designs Stroll On Gaiter fits almost any boot and is tough enough for rough and tumble. Classic styling in hard-wearing nylon with a waterproof coating is comfortable and easy to adjust for the best fit. The rear zip and metal lace hook make donning them a breeze; Duke of Edinburgh's Award expeditionists and those wanting a decent gaiter at a great price will be more than happy with the Stroll On Gaiter.
