Google.title: Hoser 1
Google.description: The Platypus Hoser 1L is the economical hydration system you can rely on - lightweight, tough and easy to use it's ideal for DofE and day walking. Platypus strive to make all their hydration systems the best in the world, letting you stay hydrated literally on the move. The Hoser lives up to this with its durable, BPA-free film and taste-free lining, welded together with a handy carry handle. With just the one opening for filling, cleaning and drinking it's very simple to use as well as to carry. Plus the threaded neck takes the screw-on hose, a push-pull cap or a closure cap for storing your water. Treated with Platypus' SlimeGuard antimicrobial technology and with the easy-clean HyperFlow bite valve it's also easy to maintain, making it the ideal choice for occasional or new walkers.

Google.title: Safety Whistle
Google.description: A loud whistle, made from a toughened plastic material, the Safety Whistle is an essential part of any outdoor or mountain survival kit. A whistle can be used to alert people if you are in distress. The internationally recognised distress signal is 6 blasts of the whistle with a 1 minute break and then repeated. The reply is 3 blasts with the same pause.

Google.title: Scotland's Mountain Ridges
Google.description: Ridges are epic, graceful carved walkways slung between summits, twisted spines of stone - these can be the most beautiful of mountain landforms. With elegant lines and giddy exposure, ridge climbs emit a powerful siren call, drawing us out onto the rocks. Life on the edge has a special quality, born of the contrast of empty space all around, and intricate detail in close-up. The crests are strangely irresistible. Scotland's ridges are among the finest mountaineering lines in the country, every one a unique adventure. The variety of these routes reflects the breadth of the mountain experience: a rich mix of summer scrambles, technical rock and challenging winter climbs. This book covers both the popular classics and some obscure gems, aiming to celebrate these thrilling climbs as much as to document them. The chosen selection spans the grade range, with routes to suit all levels of ability. Whether an earthbound hillwalker or an accomplished climber, Scotland's ridges cannot fail to stir your imagination.

Google.title: * Freney 40
Google.description: The Grivel Freney 40 is both a mountaineering and ski touring bag. It is packed with useful accessories, stretch side pockets, front mesh pocket for the helmet, carrier for ice axes, ski protection in hypalon underneath the side compression straps with stops for the skis, elastic poles carrier retractable, top compression straps to reduce the volume and a dedicated interior pocket for the hydration system. The carry system uses the 'butterfly' system which adapts to the body of the carrier with a simple sliding weight distribution system and adjustable chest strap.

Google.title: Thermolite XL
Google.description: The Leki Thermolite XL is based on the original Thermolite performance pole, upgraded with SpeedLock adjusters and an extra long grip for full versatility. The same super-stiff aluminium alloy makes up the body of this sturdy lightweight pole. It's also got the same top-end moulded foam grip and premium wriststrap. The differences are most apparent when you're on changing terrain - with the SpeedLock adjusters you can quickly get the length right for every incline or decline. Or if it's only a short hill, just grab the extra-long extended grips to shorten them without stopping. An ultralight pole that's not short on features, the Thermolight XL was made to give you maximum performance and comfort on every challenge.

Google.title: The Aiguilles Rouges - Piola 2004
Google.description: A new guide to the rock routes in the popular Aiguilles Rouges situated on the southern side of the Chamonix Valley. The guide is fully illustrated with colour and B/W action shots and every crag/cliff has a detailed easy to follow topo. Published in the same format as his last guide to the Envers Des Aiguilles; this new guide will prove to be invaluable to visiting climbers wishing to get out on the crags when the higher Mont Blanc massif is inaccessible due to bad weather.

Google.title: NeoAir Xtherm Small
Google.description: The Thermarest NeoAir XTherm Small is the best way to get excellent thermal performance at seriously low packweight. Taking up similar space to a wide-mouth bottle and weighing just over 300 grams, you nevertheless get four-season warmth for your torso. It's also comfortable, with two layers of interlocking triangular baffles forming a reliable sleeping surface. Just add something for your legs - a rope or rucksack - and you're set for a good night's sleep that won't weigh you down in the morning.

Google.title: NeoAir XLite Small
Google.description: Thermarest NeoAir XLite Small: NeoAir technology changed what people expect from a backpacking mattress. Warm, comfortable and extremely lightweight, our next-generation NeoAir mattress delivers even greater performance than the original. The streamlined shape makes the XLite mattress ultra light and highly packable, while continuing to provide the comfort you need in the backcountry. Stuff sack and repair kit included.

Google.title: NeoAir XLite Women's
Google.description: The Thermarest NeoAir XLite Women's Regular uses NeoAir technology to reduce the weight you need to carry on three-season trips. Warm, comfortable and extremely lightweight, the NeoAir XLite is the lightest of the NeoAir range, 15 to 25 percent lighter than the XTherm equivalents. The streamlined shape facilitates the XLite's extreme packability, while continuing to provide the comfort you need for a good night's sleep in the backcountry. The Women's version offers extra warmth in addition to plenty of sink-into-it support for your whole body. You'll never need to balance comfort with pack weight again with the Thermarest NeoAir XLite Women's Regular.

Google.title: Prolite Plus Small
Google.description: When staying warm and comfortable is as important as keeping your pack light, the Thermarest ProLite Plus Small mattress is an excellent solution. Patent-pending diagonal-cut foams reduce convective heat loss through the mat, making it the ideal choice for ski-touring, cold weather expeditions and winter camping.Self-inflating foam is substantial enough to keep you comfortable while mountaineering or ski touring, yet rolls up small and light enough that you'll have no problem taking it as far as you want to go. Especially as the Small version provides cushioning for just your torso to save weight. A solidly warm matress for year-round fast and light use, the Thermarest Prolite Plus is the only mat you need for everything you do.

Google.title: Prolite Small
Google.description: To go fast you've got to go light, but that's no reason to be uncomfortable - the Therm-A-Rest Prolite Small Mattress gives the best of both worlds. It's made from materials selected for packability and light weight, but you'd be wrong to think that it's all about the carry as 2.5cm of high-quality foam is more than enough for a good night's sleep. For minimalists and very young campers and backpackers, the Small size offers a way of cutting even more weight off your pack while retaining comfort and insulation at night. It's the precision cut-outs in the foam that make the Prolite the lightest and most compact mattress available without impacting on comfort. Shaped for longevity, the holes shave out the maximum possible weight while maintaining the support and insulation needed for three-season trips. Further aided by the tapered, rounded shape that cushions your shoulders and hips, the Prolite Small tips the balance at 310 grams and rolls down to only 8 cm diameter yet has enough warmth and comfort for anyone who doesn't suffer from cold feet. For a quiet night's sleep after a long day on the trail, you won't find a smaller, lighter mattress than the Prolite for the warmth.

Google.title: Prolite Womens
Google.description: To go fast you've got to go light, but that's no reason to be uncomfortable - the Therm-A-Rest Prolite Women's mattress gives the best of both worlds. It's made from materials selected for packability and light weight, but you'd be wrong to think that it's all about the carry as 2.5cm of high-quality foam is more than enough for a good night's sleep. It's the precision cut-outs in the foam that make the Prolite the lightest and most compact mattress available without impacting massively on comfort. Shaped for longevity, the holes shave out the maximum possible weight while maintaining the support and insulation needed for three-season trips. Further aided by the tapered, rounded shape and women's-specific reduced length, the Prolite Women's tips the balance at 460 grams and rolls down to only 11 cm diameter yet has enough length and breadth for women up to five foot six inches in height. The cushioning is also customised with fewer cut-outs under your hips and feet to provide extra cushioning and warmth where they're most needed. For a quiet night's sleep after a long day on the trail, you won't find a smaller, lighter mattress than the Prolite for the warmth.

Google.title: Compact Chair 20
Google.description: The Thermarest Compack Chair 20 weighs less than 200g, so it's hard to deny yourself the added luxury and convenience of a chair even when backpacking. Thermarest's lightest and most compact chair sleeve is designed for use with all Thermarest mattresses that are 51cm wide. That includes those in the NeoAir range as well as self-inflating mattresses like the Trail Pro and the Prolite. Constructed from ultralight siliconised nylon with aluminium poles, it packs incredibly small and makes a rational as well as comfortable addition to even the lightest loads.

Google.title: Trekker Chair 20
Google.description: The Thermarest Trekker Chair 20 gives you the comfort of an upright or recliner seat at considerably lower weight and packsize. Simple to use and constructed from durable materials, it packs down small enough to fit inside your rucksack and weighs under 300 grams, but stands up to sitting on all sorts of surfaces without issue. With adjustable straps between the seat and backrest you can choose the angle you recline at too, feeling comfortably supported whether you're cooking the dinner or chatting round the campfire. The lightweight way to add comfort to your extended backpacking trip; the Thermarest Trekker Chair lets you take a bit of luxury anywhere.

Simple to use and constructed from durable materials, it packs down small enough to fit inside your rucksack and weighs only 368 grams, but stands up to sitting on all sorts of surfaces without issue. With adjustable straps between the seat and backrest you can choose the angle you recline at too, feeling comfortably supported whether you're cooking the dinner or chatting round the campfire. The lightweight way to add comfort to your extended backpacking trip; the Thermarest Trekker Chair lets you take a bit of luxury anywhere.

Google.title: MicroRocket
Google.description: The MSR MicroRocket stove takes full-on burning performance to the extremes of low weight and packsize. The little brother of the MSR PocketRocket is small enough to fit into an MSR Insulated or Stainless Steel Mug. But it unfolds with a few snappy moves into a miniature powerhouse capable of boiling a litre of water in three and a half minutes. It's also specialised to keep heating your food if the breeze gets up, with a WindClip protector on the focused burner head. And it's supplied with a smart piezo igniter whose fuel-gathering tube makes lighting the stove more reliable in the wind. The mountain marathon-runner's friend, the MSR MicroRocket lets you cut down on weight but not performance.

Google.title: WhisperLite Universal
Google.description: The MSR WhisperLite Universal stove gives you the best of both worlds for cooking on every trip, burning both canister gas and liquid fuels. Use gas canisters when they're available, set on a stand to enable liquid feed - great for cold conditions. But for longer, more remote trips and really cold weather the WhisperLite switches to burning a range of liquid fuels with a minimum of fuss. Better still, Air Control technology maintains the efficiency by optimising the fuel-air mixture for each type. The WhisperLite Universal backpacking stove is made for straightforward cooking - particularly when burning gas canisters it has the broad burner head and simmering capability for things like pasta and simple sauces. The lightweight but stable design folds to fit in larger pans and the stove is easy to maintain on a trip with Shaker Jet technology and simple disassembly. Specialised for everything, the WhisperLite Universal deserves its reputation as the most effective hybrid-fuel stove ever made.

Google.title: WhisperLite International Combo
Google.description: The MSR WhisperLite International Combo is a legend in the multi-fuel game, letting backpackers cook simple meals efficiently using a wide range of fuels. The Combo includes a mid-sized MSR fuel bottle, meaning that you just add fuel to get going. Ideal for long trips when gas canisters aren't an option and for cooking in cold conditions or at altitude, the WhisperLite International is made tough but lightweight for expedition life. This proven backpacking stove is excellent for straightforward cooking; the broad burner head and moderate flame adjustment give you enough flexibility to simmer and heat foods like pasta, rice etc. The lightweight but stable design folds to fit in most pans and the stove is easy to maintain on a trip with Shaker Jet technology and simple disassembly. Optimised for the demands of extended trips abroad, the WhisperLite International marries efficiency to performance in one compact package.

Optimised for the demands of extended trips abroad, the WhisperLite International marries efficiency to performance in one compact package.

Google.title: WindPro 2
Google.description: The MSR WindPro 2 stove is ultra-efficient, extremely stable for large pans and weighs less than 200g, plus it's got the flame control for proper cooking. Especially useful in cold conditions, the WindPro's remote canister stand enables liquid feed to the burner for more consistent performance through the life of the canister. The burner itself is also well-designed, with wide, sturdy legs and pot supports that take pans up to ten inches in diameter. The wide head spreads the heat so that with the fine control you can find the ideal level for whatever you're cooking. Highly efficient in more ways than one, the WindPro 2 is the lightweight option for elaborate and group cooking on the trail.

Google.title: Carbon-Core Stake Kit
Google.description: The MSR Carbon Core Stake Kit consists of four of the lightest full-strength tent pegs you can buy, no ifs, no buts. Resembling oversized nails, these little legends weigh less than 6g apiece, but are perfectly adequate for regular duty holding up your ultralight shelter. The key is hidden inside - the body of the peg is a carbon fibre tube, protected by an aluminium skin and with a hard plastic tip to penetrate the earth. While clearly they require a little care in pitching to achieve a long life, these remarkably pins will amaze you with their performance and help to shave even more grams off your minimalist pack.

Google.title: Reflective Utility Cord Kit
Google.description: The MSR Reflective Utility Cord Kit gives you fifteen metres of cord and four CamRing Tensioners; the possibilities are endless! Hanging tarps, replacing guylines and making temporary repairs or washing lines are some of the more usual uses of this handy stuff. 3mm in diameter for plenty of strength, it shows up brilliantly in the merest hint of torchlight. That makes it fantastic for marking your territory on a busy campsite or even making lightweight, night-visible zip pullers. You could even mark a trail to the natural bathroom or lay it round your tent to avoid people tripping over pegs. CamRing Cord Tensioners extend the possible uses, letting you create a great level of tension with ease. It's amazing what you can do with a bit of accessory cord - the Reflective Cord Kit is a must-have item in any standby repair kit.

Google.title: Cam-Ring Cord Tensioners
Google.description: If you don't get on with the average guyline runner, you need MSR CamRing Cord Tensioners to cut both weight and hassle in one. Sliding easily then locking securely, they're seriously easy to install and even easier to use. Simply thread your guyline through two adjacent holes, then in through the third, knot and you're done. The camming action provides tenacious hold in the windiest conditions and 6000-series aluminium barely weighs anything. A smart upgrade or reliable replacement for your lightweight tent.

Google.title: Shock Cord Replacement Kit
Google.description: Shock cords lose elasticity and begin to fail over time. Upgrade your tent poles with this premium shock cord replacement kit. The silicone-core shock cord provided with this kit outlasts natural rubber and remains elastic to -40 F/C. In addition, the kit includes detailed instructions and all the materials you need to replace the shock cord on a typical three person backpacking tent.

Google.title: Universal Gear Loft
Google.description: The MSR Universal Gear Loft fits almost any small tent, giving you extra space and making it easier to dry small items and keep your gear in order. On longer trips and overnighters alike, having a place to keep things like headtorches, snacks and socks can make a massive difference to tent life. Being mesh, this handy add-on shelf is particularly useful for keeping bits of gear in reach and fits virtually any tent thanks to the highly adjustable straps. It's even got a zipped pocket for the really small stuff. And the flexible wire frame lets it pack away in seconds. Simple but effective - the Universal Gear Loft is just the way good design should be.

Google.title: Fabric Repair Kit
Google.description: Quick, easy and permanent tent repairs are the preserve of the MSR Fabric Repair Kit, with two types of patches for all materials. Four clear patches work on flysheet and inner tent fabrics, covering tears and holes. NoSeeUm mesh patches stick to the mesh panels to maintain bug-free ventilation. Both are quick and easy to apply with pre-applied adhesive and stick permanently for reliable repairs in the field.

Google.title: Universal Zipper Pulls
Google.description: MSR Universal Zipper Pulls are a useful spare for your repair kit, letting you replace a damaged zipper pull or just enhancing the useability of your gear. Lightweight, reflective and easy to use in gloves or mitts, they're also quieter than metal zippers on tents when it's breezy. So you can banish the tapping from your dreams on windy nights. SImple to add - just lark's-foot the block through the attached loop and enjoy increased performance at lower weight too.

Google.title: Big Air XP Package
Google.description: The Black Diamond Big Air XP Package is an essential belay/rappel package featuring the multiple-friction ATC-XP. The ATC-XP maintains the silky-smooth feeding of the ATC but ups the braking power thanks to its grooved rope slots. The Mini Pearabiner scewgate biner is a compact, lightweight locker with a non-snagging keylock nose and a large rope-bearing surface for smooth belays and rappels.

Google.title: Icon
Google.description: With a modern, redesigned look and an unparalleled 200-lumen output, the all-new Black Diamond Icon Headlamp is our professional-grade light with a waterproof construction that's ready for anything you can throw at it. Whether you're rappelling an alpine route in a storm or participating in a SAR mission, this mega-bright headlamp's multiple modes let you customize your lighting needs to any situation and its IPX 7 waterproof rating makes it a true all-weather light. The Icon's red LEDs preserve your night vision and activate without cycling through the white mode, while the lock mode prevents accidental battery drain when the headlamp is in your pack.

Google.title: Ion
Google.description: The light that should be in every pack you own, the Black Diamond Ion provides ultralight, just-in-case lighting for anytime the sun goes to bed before you're back at the car. A single, 12-lumen SinglePower LED helps you make it down the rappels or find the trail, and the momentary switch prevents accidental battery drain when the Ion is in your pack.

Google.title: Trail Shock Compact
Google.description: A lightweight, do-anything pole with premium shock absorption thanks to our Control Shock Technology, The Black Diamond Trail Shock Compact Trekking Pole is a shorter, smaller-grip version of our Trail Shock and handles a short hike on the local trail as easily as a week-long trek on the Continental Divide. Control Shock Technology gives the pole progressive absorption and controlled rebound under any load, and dual FlickLock adjustments let you customize the pole length for any situation. The Trail Shock also features our interchangeable carbide Tech Tips, which can easily be swapped for our rubber Tech Tips (sold separately) to accommodate different trail surfaces.

Google.title: Trek glasses - black - spectron 4
Google.description: The Trek's mission is simple: to achieve optimum performance while moving fast in extreme environments by providing highly technical, yet lightweight eyewear. For those committed to the outdoors via mountaineering, climbing and trail running, the Trek is the perfect combination of technical mountaineering principles and lightweight performance ergonomics. Detachable shields block lateral rays from intense glare as well as offer superior ventilation when necessary. Julbo's Flex Nose design and 360 adjustable temples provide optimum hold. The Spectron 4 lens is light but with excellent shock resistance. This versatile lens is suitable for all types of sports activities.

Google.title: Peak Limestone Rockfax
Google.description: May 2012 sees the publishing of the first single volume guidebook to Peak Limestone to have hit the shelves for many years. The last edition of Northern Limestone included much of Yorkshire too, this time round the Peak District gets its own dedicated coverage, with Yorkshire to follow. The book features expanded photographic coverage of the classic venues of Stoney, Cheedale and Water-cum-Jolly plus all the southern crags around Matlock, Dovedale and the Manifold Valley. The many routes that have been put up in recent years are included, plus a reassessment of the classics. On top of this there are a number of recently developed quarries that have become a magnet for sport climbers, including the ever-popular Horseshoe and Masson Lees. The striking crag-shots are backed up with full route descriptions and a superb set of action pictures that should inspire even the most jaded grit guru.

Google.title: Micro Vario Titanium Poles
Google.description: Leki Micro Vario Titanium Poles are so light and easy to pack that you'll wonder how you ever got on strapping your sticks outside your pack. An evolution of the popular Leki Micro Sticks, Micro Varios offer a similarly lightweight solution with the added benefit of length adjustment to fine-tune them or for ascent. Despite the name, they're actually made from high quality aluminium for lightweight durability. Push-button assembly is quick and easy as well as highly reliable thanks to the kevlar-reinforced tensioning rope and the SpeedLock lever fastening provides 20cm of continuous length adjustment to get them the right length for you. Then when you reach the Via Ferrata or need to pack for your flight, just fold them down for a tiny 38 cm packed length, plenty small enough to go inside your pack or case. Lightweight doesn't have to mean compromising comfort either, since the hollow Aergon grip has no edges to dig into your hand and can be held in a number of ways. Versatile, strong and highly packable; the Micro Vario Ti pole is the lightweight hiker's dream pole.

Google.title: Micro Vario Titanium Poles
Google.description: Leki Micro Vario Titanium Poles are so light and easy to pack that you'll wonder how you ever got on strapping your sticks outside your pack. An evolution of the popular Leki Micro Sticks, Micro Varios offer a similarly lightweight solution with the added benefit of length adjustment to fine-tune them or for ascent. Despite the name, they're actually made from high quality aluminium for lightweight durability. Push-button assembly is quick and easy as well as highly reliable thanks to the kevlar-reinforced tensioning rope and the SpeedLock lever fastening provides 20cm of continuous length adjustment to get them the right length for you. Then when you reach the Via Ferrata or need to pack for your flight, just fold them down for a tiny 38 cm packed length, plenty small enough to go inside your pack or case. Lightweight doesn't have to mean compromising comfort either, since the hollow Aergon grip has no edges to dig into your hand and can be held in a number of ways. Versatile, strong and highly packable; the Micro Vario Ti pole is the lightweight hiker's dream pole.

Google.title: Dynaclip 75cm Lanyard
Google.description: The Beal Dynaclip is a dynamic lanyard specifically designed for clipping anchors on sport routes. Larks-foot it into your belay loop and use it as you would a sling, the big difference being that in a factor 1 fall the Beal Dynaclip reduces the impact force to less than half of that of a dyneema sling!

Google.title: ex Distance Pedometer
Google.description: Silva ex distance pedometer is compact, lightweight, easy to use and features a new, contemporary design with warm colour accents on a glossy white body. A newly designed robust clip secures the unit to the waist belt in the best possible way, but just in case, there's a safety lanyard to prevent accidental loss. The unique built-in filter function prevents the unwanted recording of occasional non-related movement during a walk, jog or day at work. The ex distance counts both steps and distance.

Google.title: ex Distance Pedometer

Google.title: ex10 Distance Pedometer
Google.description: The Silva ex10 Distance pedometer counts steps and measures distance. It's based on Accumotion, a new type of sensor which improves step counting. This sensor can be tilted up to an angle of 45, making step counting accurate when used on any shape of body. Silva ex10 Distance is carried around the neck, and has an integrated neck strap with safety release. The pedometer is water resistant, and has easy access buttons on the sides for setting functions. When the pedometer is not in use the display goes into sleep mode to save battery power.

Google.title: Apex Ice Axe
Google.description: A new, radically curved technical tool for hard icefalls and modern mixed climbing. The Apex is a superbly balanced precision tool: ready to tackle steep ice, massive mountain routes and mixed test pieces. The curved shaft provides an ergonomic hand position and impressive clearance around bulging ice. Can be used with leashes in traditional climbing mode, but excels without leashes for the more modern approach. The new one piece T rated Ice and Mix picks cover all the bases.

Google.title: Fly Axe Mixed Pick
Google.description: The iconic DMM Fly: the all-round climbing axe brought bang up to date for 2012. Tried and tested the world over, DMMs' go anywhere, do anything, classic winter tool has just got better. The original Fly has been used on the first ascents of challenging lines throughout the world for the last two decades. With this latest evolution, we've updated the tools with modern climbing in mind: an improved handle, a lower hand rest as standard, and the option to add on an upper rest for leashless climbing.

Google.title: Fly Axe Mixed Pick
Google.description: The iconic DMM Fly: the all-round climbing axe brought bang up to date for 2012. Google.title: Cirque Alpine Hammer 50cm
Google.description: The updated DMM Cirque Alpine Hammer provides the functionality you need in a second axe when walking becomes climbing. Designed to be fully trustworthy for self-arrest and a last option for belay anchoring, the T-rated pick and shaft combine with double-riveted construction to give the Cirque a reassuringly solid feel. The new hammer option even allows use when placing pitons in ice or cracks. The slightly curved shaft adds enough climbing functionality to this all-rounder for it to be practical as a second axe for steeper sections. Winter scramblers and walkers who enjoy some chilly verticality will love the versatility of the latest DMM Cirque.

Google.title: Cirque Alpine Hammer 50cm

Google.title: Bulldog Ice Anchor
Google.description: Winter climbing protection is often about making the best of what's available. In an ideal world, this would be ice screws in bullet hard ice and 'bomber' rock pretection throughout. However, our winter world is far from ideal and so inventive use of DMMs' Bulldog has been crucial in offering protection in frozen turf, thin icy cracks and marginal ice smears for over a decade. DMMs' updated bulldog keeps its versatility, but it's lighter, easier to place and easier to remove than it's predecessor.

Google.title: Boa HMS 3 Colour Pack
Google.description: This is the 'Big Daddy' of lockers - the ultimate rigging biner and one which is super strong and super tough. It is large enough to accommodate several knots and has a very wide gate opening - just what you need in a rigging situation. All of which makes it a great centre use biner, but the story doesn't end there. Despite its name, the Big Boa is surprisingly light; by giving it an I-Beam construction we've reduced the overall weight by almost 25%. Add in the fact that it is easy to handle in gloves and the appeal to winter climbers is obvious.

Google.title: Ultra O 3 Colour Pack
Google.description: The Ultra O Screwgate could be described as the perfect aid climbing biner - it certainly performs remarkably well in the big wall environment and the I-Beam construction gives it an excellent strength to weight ratio. Perhaps multi day ascents, sac hauling, portaledges and extreme dehydration (eek!) are not your bag, but that doesn't mean you should turn your back on the oval biner design, far from it. At some point all of us will need to use a pulley system, most likely in a rescue situation. Oval biners are important because they allow pulleys to sit in a correctly loaded and equalised position. The symmetrical shape also stops them shifting under load and potentially dislodging a marginal gear placement. The locking gate adds a final element of security to the system.

Google.title: Mont Blanc Super Cracks
Google.description: The ultimate guide to Mont Blanc crack climbs, the guide covers Mont Blanc du Tacul, the Aiguilles de Chamonix, the Midi and the Plan des Aiguilles, the Envers des Aiguilles, the mer de Glace plus much more. The guide is in full colour with easy to follow topos and route descriptions as well as approach information. English language.

Google.title: Core Glacier Gray
Google.description: Superb construction and style. The Core range of altimeter products provide a huge array of features to help you enjoy your outdoor pursuits. Superb features include storm alarm which senses dramatic drop in barometric pressure, highly accurate altimeter, a variety of timers and of course a digital compass. Unique features of the core range: The pressure gauge operates in four distinct modes, including an automatic setting that senses vertical movement, switching between altimeter and barometer accordingly thus ensuring absolute accuracy. The compass features a rotating bezel for traditional use, or a one-touch function that allows you to sight, and follow a bearing.

Google.title: BMC Dark Peak
Google.description: Covering the popular highpoints of the Dark Peak. Printed on polyethylene - durable, tear-resistant and 100% waterproof. Made in cooperation with the British Mountaineering Council, colour shading for easy identification of hills and valleys.Less than half the weight of a laminated map, detailed 1:20,000 enlargements of the Kinder plateau. Geological map the Dark Peak supplied by the British Geological Survey. Mountain incident and first aid advice, tips on using your map and compass. Useful local phone numbers and websites

Google.title: BMC White Peak
Google.description: This all-weather British Mountain Map for climbers, hill walkers, mountaineers and mountain bikers is published by HARVEY in cooperation with the British Mountaineering Council. The colourful geological map on the back gives an understanding of the land form and was specially designed by the British Geological Survey. All of the White Peak's hills and dales on a single map Climbers' crags highlighted and named. Colour shading for easy identification of hills and valleys Printed on polyethylene - durable, tearproof and 100% waterproof. Less than half the weight of a laminated map. The reverse side of the map includes: Map extensions: east to Matlock and north to Edale, Geological map, Mountain incident, first aid and navigation advice, Useful local phone numbers and websites.

Google.description: Black Diamond Narrow Fit Crampon Bails are 8cm across. This is narrower by 0.5cm than the standard version and is suitable for any model within the current BD Crampon Pro Range. They are ideal for very narrow boots, especially in smaller sizes.

Google.title: * Quasar 45
Google.description: The Terra Nova Quasar 45 is a lightweight and compact mountaineering pack, combining Terra Nova's Matrix and Ultra fabrics. A lightweight, simple and compact pack, the Quasar has the extra durability needed for alpine or expedition use. Using Terra Nova Matrix fabric for high strength but low weight and reinforced with Dyneema/Cordura fabric for high wear areas - despite the extremely lightweight, durability has not been compromised. All stitching is with super strong Coat 50s thread, except bar tack points, which use Dyneema thread with a weight to strength ratio 10 times that of steel.

Google.title: Nomic
Google.description: The NOMIC allows the entire rock climbing repertoire to be transferred to ice. Thanks to its adjustable ergonomic handle, it offers multiple grip modes and limits the risk of snagging when switching hands. The ICE pick allows easy penetration in any type of ice, and pulls out easily. The modular head has two removable pick weights to balance the axe and propel it into the ice with an exceptional swing. The NOMIC can also be equipped with a hammer when placing pitons.

Google.title: Ultralite Full Orange

Ideal for staying light on your feet whether you're out wild camping or trying to find your perfect festival pitch. The Ultralite Self Inflating Mat will keep you warm and comfortable on the Black Mountains or the hills of Worthy Farm.

Google.title: Hyperflow Bite Valve
Google.description: The Platypus HyperFlow Bite Valve is a simple and efficient replacement part for your hydration system; leak-free to full-flow with merely a squeeze. Fitting the HyperFlow valve to Platypus Hoser and Big Zip systems is extremely simple - pull off the old mouthpiece and pop on the new. So easy in fact, that it's worth considering instead of doing the fiddly cleaning an old, furred-up bite valve. Of course, it's also useful if the original valve goes missing. Give your Hoser a new lease of life - fit a new HyperFlow Bite Valve for top performance and ease of use.

Google.title: * Go Big GoPro Mount
Google.description: K-EDGE GO BIG Adapter Mount is a universal mount designed to lock your GoPro camera securely to whatever you'd like. This is the same secure GoPro attachment system that the handlebar mount uses. Screw, bolt, or rivet.. you've got a rock solid mount to attach your GoPro camera. Buy 3 or 4 and turn your car, skis, motor, kiteboard, sled, etc. into the ultimate video rocket ship.

Same secure two-bolt clamp attachment system as their Pro Handlebar Mount and a wide range of camera angle choices. Easy adjustment whether you choose the view ahead or the view of you. No more vibration in your videos, no more cameras falling off your bike, and most important no more lost memories.

Google.title: ! Canyoning in S Europe
Google.description: Canyoning, the descent of natural gorges by a mixture of hiking, scrambling, swimming and abseiling is a spicy mix of the fun and the adventurous. This is a guide to canyoning in the limestone areas of the western Mediterranean, stretching from the Costa Blanca via the Pyrenees to Provence, Sardinia and Mallorca. Selective in nature, it includes a selection of recommended gorge descents, ranging from two-hour strolls to long-day aquatic expeditions. The more technical expeditions invariably involve abseiling and scrambling. Yet most canyons are within reach for anyone in possession of these skills and, in the case of wet canyons, a one-piece wetsuit. The friendly Mediterranean canyons are great places to 'learn the ropes', and the guide therefore provides a basic grounding in techniques and skills for the less experienced. Want to come and see what's around the next corner?

Google.title: Ripper Standard
Google.description: Try as we might to avoid it, there are occasions when we have to rely upon marginal gear placements. Whether that's a small, but crucial wire, or a suspect ice screw placement is not important. What matters is that we can improve the odds of it holding under impact. The answer to this conundrum is the Ripstop. These cleverly constructed quickdraws contain sections of weaker stitching that are designed to break when shock loaded. Each of the stitches that break absorbs some of the energy that would otherwise have been transferred into the marginal runner. The overall effect is to reduce the peak impact force, which is a rather fancy way of saying that your gear is less likely to rip. Keep one clipped to your harness; you never know when you'll need it next.

Google.title: Dyno Bouldering Mat
Google.description: Britain's only manufacturer of climbing hardware, DMM have built a solid reputation for quality and value from their base in Llanberis, Wales. Continual innovation with input from top climbers means their range includes some truly world-leading products. The Dyno is a taco-style bouldering mat for problems where height of fall isn't the main problem. The high density layers are thick enough to protect over the whole surface of the mat, with no folds or joins, but thin enough to wrap and mould around and into rocks and crevasses, and the smaller than average total thickness allows use where there is limited clearance from the floor. Top quality materials, moveable straps for options when carrying and a starter carpet for cleaning your shoes off combine to make this your indispensible friend on every bouldering trip to places like Burbage and Font.

Google.title: * Camera Tethers
Google.description: Go Pro Camera Tethers add an extra layer of security when using your GoPro in extreme conditions. Attach the Adhesive Anchors to your gear, then secure the Camera Tethers to the camera housing backdoor. If your GoPro comes loose, it will remain attached to your gear. Adhesive Anchor can be removed by applying heat from a hair dryer, then peeling off.

Google.title: Aero Straight Gate Black
Google.description: The Aero Straight Gate Black is a versatile biner that's useful throughout your rack, but particularly for clipping on to bolts. Easy to clip and unclip thanks to the clean nose, it's now even easier to handle and grip with improved gate shaping. Tactical black anodising adds a different colour option to your rack organisation or aids low-profile night climbing. An improved version of a favourite karabiner; choose the 2013 Aero Straight Gate when you can afford a couple of extra grams for loads of extra handleability.

Google.title: Aero Bent Gate Black
Google.description: The Aero Bent has gained popularity because it combines superb handling and functionality with exceptional strength and safety features. The robustness of this hot forged, solid gate biner makes it well suited to sport climbing. It is designed to work at the rope-clipping end of a quickdraw; the bent gate giving a quick and easy clip every time. It also has a large (26mm) gate opening and a clean nose design to reduce snagging.

Google.title: Helix Ice Screw - Short
Google.description: Grivel's easiest ice screw - the Helix Short ice screw bites easily, drives easily and even racks easily! The handle on the grip makes placing the screw simple and being colour-coded, allows you to pick the right one first time every time. Grivel's reputation for high quality design and value for money was built on products like this.

Google.title: 360 Ice Screw - Short
Google.description: When time is of the essence, you can rely on the Grivel 360 ice screw for a quick, reliable placement where you need it. Instead of a fixed handle with a wide plate, the 360 boasts a folding handle that avoids obstructions of rock and ice but still provides enough torque to sink the screw straight in. With a super-slick finish to let ice slide easily out of the core and technologically advanced thread design, the days of searching for a useable placement are gone.

Google.title: Speedy Short
Google.description: Faster, safer, lighter: you can't lose with the Grivel Speedy short ice screw, and you can't lose it either! Ready to go with a freely rotating shackle holding the 20cm Dyneema sling and Gamma carabiner, the possibility of dropping the screw before placing or after removal is virtually negated. Just clip it into the rope before placing and you're covered, then when it's safely back on your harness use the handy ring to keep the krab from dangling. The Speedy ice screw weighs 15% less than the equivalent screw/quickdraw combination and makes the whole placement process quicker and easier - a bonus on cascade ice.

Google.title: Group Shelter 8-10 Bothy
Google.description: Keep a group of up to ten people warm in case of an incident, or just to have lunch, in the Rab Group Shelter 8-10 Bothy. Lightweight windproof and waterproof polyester fabric traps air which is quickly warmed by the body heat of people sitting inside, creating a space much warmer than the outside and thus ideal for keeping a casualty or even the whole group warm while waiting for assistance. Simply shake out the whole bothy, duck underneath and sit on the waterproof seats around the bottom of the walls to keep it upright. If further support is needed, recesses in the roof take walking poles, while vents release excess vapour to prevent too much condensation forming inside. The bright colour and reflective piping keep you as visible as possible, and there's a window at each end so occupants can keep an eye on the outside world. Essential kit for group leaders and groups of friends in the hills, mountains or anywhere that shelters are few and far between, the bothy is supplied with a drawstring stuffsack for compactness and, weighing considerably less than a kilogram, is about the lightest of its type and size available.

Essential kit for group leaders, the bothy is supplied with a drawstring stuffsack and, weighing considerably less than a kilogram, is one of the lightest of its type and size available.

Google.title: Group Shelter 4-6 Bothy
Google.description: In the Rab Integral Designs Group Shelter 4-6 Bothy you can keep a group of up to six people warm in case of an incident. Lightweight windproof and waterproof polyester fabric traps air which is quickly warmed by the body heat of people sitting inside, creating a space much warmer than the outside and thus ideal for keeping a casualty and the whole group warm while waiting for assistance. Whenever you have to stop, simply shake out the whole bothy, duck underneath and sit on the waterproof seats around the bottom of the walls to keep it upright. If further support is needed, recesses in the roof take walking poles, while vents release excess vapour to prevent too much condensation forming inside. The bright colour and reflective piping keep you as visible as possible, and there's a window at each end so occupants can keep an eye on the outside world. Essential kit for group leaders, the bothy is supplied with a drawstring stuffsack and, weighing considerably less than a kilogram, is one of the lightest of its type and size available.

Google.title: Easy Rider Via Ferrata Set
Google.description: The ultimate, smooth-clipping via ferrata set-up, the Easy Rider will have you efficiently climbing the "iron way" in style. The two Easy Rider carabiners have hot-forged bodies, gates and triggers with ergonomically contoured shapes for easy clip/unclip action and comfort. The biners also have a patent-pending internal locking mechanism and squeeze actuation, which provides excellent ease-of-use, eliminates hand pinch potential and greatly increases the ergonomic function of the carabiner. The Energy Absorption System (EAS) is stored in a durable, zippered pouch and is constructed using a compact, internal-sewn webbing system with a patent-pending sew construction. The two lanyards have internal elastic for a tangle-free design and are individually sewn into the EAS.

Google.title: Trangia 25/2 with Kettle + Gas Burner
Google.description: Series 25 includes somewhat larger stoves suitable for groups of about 3-4 people. They are excellent family stoves with capacious pans, a wider frypan and a larger kettle. With the supports in the raised position, the stove can be used with large billies from the rest of the Trangia range. All the stove systems in the 25 series have two saucepans (1.75 and 1.5 litres), a 22 cm frying pan, windshields (upper and lower), a burner, a pan grip and a strap. Dimensions 22 x 10,5 cm.

Google.title: Portable Mosquito Killer
Google.description: A battery powered insect killer unit that can be used independantly in large tents, huts and hotels where mains power is not readily available. The unit slowly propels an odourless scent that is harmless to humans, but extremely effective against biting insects. The unit is supplied with a single cartridge that provides up to 7 nights* protection before it needs to be replaced (replacement cartridges are available separately). The unit requires 2 AA batteries which will also last approximately 7 nights. * 1 night = 8 hours approx.

Google.title: EX3 Silk Sleeper Rectangular Black
Google.description: Made from 100% silk these luxurious sleepers are compact, light and comfortable to use. A silk sleeper can be used on its own as an ultralight travel sleeping bag in warm climates or as a liner to a sleeping bag. These have the added benefit of our Ex3 treatment. This means that your sleeper will protect you against the build up of bacteria, act as a barrier against bed bugs as well as containing a mosquito repellent.

Google.title: Alpine 4 Pot Set
Google.description: The MSR Alpine 4 Pot Set has the clean, simple durability of stainless steel in a weight-saving design that caters for a small group of hungry climbers. Tough enough for serious conditions and heavy use, the clever, nesting design keeps packspace to a minimum, particularly as the lid can double as a plate. This versatile set is optimised for efficiency, making it ideal for guides and frequent travellers who want to cook a lot of wide-ranging but straightforward meals during all sorts of trips. Three pans with fitting lids and a lightweight, interchangeable handle nest together, with MSR Alpine Plates and Bowls if you prefer. So if reliability trumps super-low weight in your book, the Alpine 4 Pot Set is the cook kit for your group.

Google.title: Quick 2 System
Google.description: The MSR Quick 2 System is the efficient cookware set for a pair of travellers - just add cutlery and you've all the gear for a simple meal. Two pans, two insulated mugs, two high-walled plates and a sturdy lid all pack together in one compact package, giving you the possibility of cooking basic meals on any trip. The set is particularly suited to use with the MSR WhisperLite and SuperFly series of stoves, since the hard-anodised aluminium pans spread the heat for fewer burnt bits in your pasta. The smaller pan is also non-stick for cooking sauces, veg etc. It's also easy to manipulate the pans around your workspace thanks to the Talon handle that clips securely but transfers easily between them. When packing, it also holds the lid of the large pan firmly on to avoid those annoying rattles. Smart design to make trail life better - the Quick 2 System adds versatility to your lightweight camp cooking.

Google.title: Base 2 Pot Set
Google.description: The MSR Base 2 Pot Set is the economical option for versatile two-person cooking on the trail, with two non-stick pans, lid and Talon handle. Lightweight aluminium keeps the weight down and the simple, straight-walled design lets the pans nest snugly together with the aluminium lid on top. There's a Talon handle that works interchangeably between the pans for reliable movement and clips the lid down for packing. Plus you get an ultralight PackTowl that sits between the pans to prevent scratching. It's the epitome of simple efficiency that can be built up into your perfect set with MSR DeepDish plates and insulated mugs. Choose the Base 2 Pot Set to keep versatile cooking within your weight and price budgets.

Google.title: Waterproofing Wax 60ml
Google.description: NEW Nikwax Waterproofing Wax for Leather is solvent and VOC (volatile organic compound) free, WaterBased and suitable for all types of smooth leather. Unlike conventional wax it has a dual application method: either sponge on with the applicator provided or rub in with a cloth or with fingers. This brilliant waterproofing wax not only keeps feet dry, but it can be used on either wet or dry leather and once applied, the items treated can be used immediately without waiting for the wax to dry. Its fast-acting, deeply penetrative ingredients add water repellency, reduce water absorption and maintain breathability. It also revives the appearance of leather, maintains its suppleness and even adds to or enhances the shine.

Google.title: Waterproofing Wax 60ml
Google.description: NEW Nikwax Waterproofing Wax for Leather is solvent and VOC (volatile organic compound) free, WaterBased and suitable for all types of smooth leather. Unlike conventional wax it has a dual application method: either sponge on with the applicator provided or rub in with a cloth or with fingers. This brilliant waterproofing wax not only keeps feet dry, but it can be used on either wet or dry leather and once applied, the items treated can be used immediately without waiting for the wax to dry. Its fast-acting, deeply penetrative ingredients add water repellency, reduce water absorption and maintain breathability. It also revives the appearance of leather, maintains its suppleness and even adds to or enhances the shine.

Google.title: The Ridges of England & Ireland
Google.description: A guide to summer scrambles, technical rock routes and winter climbs on ridges in the Lake District, Snowdonia, Peak District, Exmoor, the Isle of Wight, Kerry and Connemara, covering popular classics and obscure gems, from Sharp Edge to Skeleton Ridge. With inspirational photographs, this book is both a celebration of the landscape and a route guide.

Google.title: ! Tour of The Queyras
Google.description: NEW EDITION: A guide to a backpacking tour of the Queyras region of the Haute Alps on the border between Italy and France, following the GR58 and GR541 trails. The route includes the highest point reached on any grand randone with 24 cols above 2000m and options to climb up to 17 summits, five above 3000m. The Queyras is a dramatic, unspoilt region in the shadow of Monte Viso, sheltered to the west by the crins, and is one of the sunniest areas of the Alps. The absence of glaciers makes ideal hillwalking country, with several high mountain summits accessible to the ordinary walker and scrambler and it's one of France's best kept secrets!

Google.title: ! White Peak Walks Southern Dales
Google.description: Mark Richards' guide to walking the southern dales of the White Peak area of the Peak District, England UK, between Ashbourne, Matlock, Buxton and Leek. 30 easy circular routes cross the high plateau and follow the Dove, Manifold and Hamps rivers through the dales in the UK's first National Park. One of two new Cicerone guides to the White Peak.

Google.title: Belay Master 2
Google.description: Totally redesigned for 2009, the ever popular Belay Master continues to set standards for safety and design. The Belay Master is a tweaked version of the Fat Boy HMS with a patented integral plastic clip that together increase the safety of the belay system. The clip can only be locked into place when the screw gate barrel is tightened into the locked position, thus providing a fail-safe check that the biner is closed securely. The plastic clip also stops the carabiner from rotating in the belay system and being cross loaded. The Belay Master is a mid-size HMS with a large rope radius and soft angles on the top bar. This means that it works well with the vast majority of belay devices.

Google.title: * SD Card Bedfordshire 1:50K
Google.description: Bedfordshire stretches across the plain of the Ouse to the Chiltern Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It is a landscape of gentle hills and valleys, peppered with woodland, heath and parkland. There are over 1500 kilometres of public footpaths traversing the county that suit all standards and styles of walkers, from short circular walks to the Icknield Way and Greensand Ridge Walk. A further 600 kilometres of bridleways and byways offer many opportunities for cyclists and horse riders alike, ensuring this picturesque county can be enjoyed by all.

Google.title: Alpine 1L Teapot
Google.description: The MSR Alpine 1-Litre TeaPot nests inside 1.5 litre MSR pans, enabling those much-needed cups of tea wherever you go. Straight-sided for easy-packing efficiency, the big lid makes boiling water or even simple cooking quick and simple, not to mention the easy cleaning. The Alpine TeaPot also has a small but serviceable spout, making sure your drink ends up in your cup and not on the ground or, worse still, your hand. Plus foldaway handles on top allow quick and confident movement even when the pot is full. It's also useful for cooking porridge and heating wet meals efficiently when carried alone. Classic style that just works in all conditions, the Alpine TeaPot is reliably efficient wherever you are.

Google.title: Flex Skillet
Google.description: The MSR Flex Skillet adds frying to the repertoire of the Flex 3 and Flex 4 Systems and still lets them pack compactly. Sized to fit inside the Flex 4 System and on the outside of the Flex 3 System, it's a compact addition that vastly increases your meal options on a longer trip. Hard-anodised aluminium with a non-stick coating is easy to cook on and easy to clean, while the insulating Talon handle keeps you in control. Bring gourmet cooking into the wilderness with the Flex Skillet from MSR.

Google.title: Monte Rosa NC
Google.description: Grivel Monte Rosa New Classic Crampons are lightweight C1 crampons suitable to use with a range of four-season mountain boots. They are superb for winter walking in the UK, a great first pair of crampons and also very good value for money. For information on the Grivel Range of Use, Click Here > Hide The Monte Rosa Crampons are essentially a basic, flexible winter walking crampon (think of a simplified G10) that is suitable for a range of B1-rated boots. The 3-Dimensional Relief Stamped (3DRS) front points offer superb torsional rigidity. The simple strap and plastic cradle configuration means that they are easy to fit on the go, whilst the flex bar is simple to adjust without the need for any tools.

Google.title: * Nitro quickdraw 20cm
Google.description: If you like the Helium quickdraw but not the price, the Wild Country Nitro Quick Draw is for you. The crabs are essentially the same as the Helium, but with a nose design that is less costly to produce. You therefore get the quality and low weight of the Helium quickdraw, with excellent value for money. I-beam construction keeps the weight amazingly low for a full-sized biner and the hooded nose helps prevent unwanted unclipping. Linked by 10mm Dyneema tape and with a Wild Country Tadpole O-ring to keep the clipping end the right way round, this is a one quickdraw to take everywhere - it performs well on sport, trad and winter routes.

Google.title: * Havoc 200 Footprint
Google.description: Protect your inner tent groundsheet from rocky or wet ground and thorns, stones - the Vango Havoc 200 Footprint is tough but lightweight. A footprint is a small addition that makes a big difference to the longevity of your tent, with the added bonus of being significantly easier to clean after pitching on muddy, wet ground. Made to measure for the Havoc 200 and supplied with its own storage bag, your tent will thank you for buying its footprint too.

Google.title: ! Froggatt to Black Rocks BMC
Google.description: The crags stretching from Froggatt and Curber in the north to Black Rocks in the south is arguably the finest and most varied collection of outcrops on gritstone. This new guide replaces the 1992 Froggatt guide and the 1998 Chatsworth guide and brings the area bang up to date featuring over 2,200 routes and over 1,100 boulder problems; it's packed with full-colour action shots and a full set of well presented photo-topos.

Google.title: TightLine Cord Tensioner
Google.description: An MSR TightLine Cord Tensioner reduces sagging and keeps the guys in the ground during wind plus it can be used with virtually any tent. Simply described, it's a guyline bungy, a shock-absorbing silicone band that attaches between the guyline and the tent so that when a big gust hits the impact on the peg is reduced. Simple and effective, it also assists with maintaining the ventilation gap between the inner and outer tents; vital for limiting condensation through the night. Pitch your tent with the TightLine and it will keep the tension on the fabric constant through the inevitable changes in temperature and humidity, so you'll always come back to a tent that's pitched as well as you left it.

Google.title: Reactor 1L Stove System
Google.description: Extreme cooking is made easier with the MSR Reactor 1.0L Stove System, designed for the remote and challenging conditions met by expeditionists. Ideal for soloists and pairs on a weight budget, the new one litre configuration provides all the excellent performance of its bigger brothers in a package as lightweight and compact as possible. Since the radiant burner head sits almost inside the base of the pot for cooking it is protected from the wind, a very high proportion of the heat goes into warming your food or melting snow - it boils half a litre of water in only 90 seconds! The litre pot can take the burner head and a 100 gram gas canister for transport and the burner is compatible with all sizes of Reactor pot giving you the flexibility for different types of trip. The proven best stove for the real world, choose a Reactor to eat quicker when it's cold.

Google.title: LuxuryLite UltraLite Cot Regular
Google.description: THE ultimate camp bed, the Thermarest LuxuryLite UltraLite Cot is not only lighter and smaller-packing than any other, it's also a better sleep experience! The words camp and bed usually summon memories of squeaks, rattles, breakage and being tipped on to the floor, but this revolutionary new design makes sleeping off the floor a brand new game of cards. From the tiny package only 41cm long, a few practised moves and you're ready to be warm, comfortable and stable all night after a long day doing what you love. Instead of heavy steel poles and braces, the LuxuryLite Cot raises the game with lightweight alloy edge poles and cross-poles, secured with super-smart, super-robust and super-durable nylon feet that minimise damage to a tent floor and support the edges so you can even sit on the side without the whole thing bucking you off; you don't have to be circumspect when lying down! Plus, in case the remarkably low packed weight is still too much for a lightweight trip, you can strip it to a minimal setup that only weighs 900 grams but still provides excellent sleeping comfort! For paramount cushioning and extra warmth on a glamping or family camping trip team it with a Thermarest mattress, or simply enjoy the supportive comfort of a camp bed without the disadvantages.

Google.title: NeoAir Dream Large
Google.description: The Thermarest NeoAir Dream Large is as versatile as a mattress can be, going from compact storage to generous comfort in moments with minimal effort. Following the huge success of the DreamTime mattress, Therm-A-Rest have evolved the design to be even more useful, so there's no longer an issue with storage. Inside the fleecy cover, under the open cell foam top layer, is a custom-made NeoAir mattress, which deflates easily and completely by rolling the mattress. It's also simple to inflate as the storage sack can be used to push air into the mattress - it's as full as you need after only a few bagfuls. Tougher than the fast and light NeoAir mattresses for durability, the base can be used without the foam and cover for a convenient, even smaller package on a lightweight trip. All the pieces together are a full 10 cm thick, which is so comfortable and insulating as to make you forget you're lying on a hard floor or rocky ground. Then all you need is a great tent and you're fixed for outdoor adventures in luxury!

Google.title: MondoKing Large
Google.description: So big it needs an over-sized valve to deflate and so comfy you'll barely believe it, Therm-A-Rest's Mondo King Large is the biggest and best self-inflating mat ever. Inside the soft fabric cover is a ten centimetre-thick pad of ultra-responsive foam, just waiting for you to sink into its depths and enjoy the contour-hugging support as you drift off to sleep. Nearly as wide as half a double bed and long enough for most sleepers to have warm feet all night, you'll have room to starfish (as much as you can in a sleeping bag anyway) and shift position in the night without falling off the edge. That's when it's inflated - open the valve, roll from the other end and you'll be amazed how small and light it packs. Rugged on the bottom to help prevent punctures and self-inflating in around fifteen minutes just by the power of the foam expanding, the Mondo King is ideal for base camp and family holidays where packsize is as important as comfort.

Google.title: Ultra Mountain Z-Pole Basket
Google.description: Specially designed to work with the new compacting poles, the Black Diamond Ultra Mountain Z-Pole Basket prevents the poles sinking into snow when walking. With two cut-outs to clip round the folded sections, the Z-Pole basket not only facilitates compact folding even when it's attached, but also keeps them folded when the poles are in your pack. Then when you get to a gradient, whip your poles out and the basket will keep your tips from sinking fathoms deep into snow or soft ground. A smart solution that works in all ways, the Ultra Mountain Z-Pole Basket makes your Ultra Mountain poles even better.

Google.title: Magnetron RockLock
Google.description: Imagine an HMS krab that autolocks infallibly, is easy to open but light and compact; imagine no more, the Black Diamond Magnetron RockLock is here. Even lighter than the equivalent twistlock, and significantly more intuitive to open, this super-secure carabiner makes setting up your belay device quicker and removes the risk of leaving the gate unlocked. Simply press the pivoted arms on either side of the gate to raise the magnets and the gate will open smoothly, with the subtly curved spine maximising the size of the opening. Release it, and the magnets click back into place with the steel insert on the snag-free keylock nose. With a square hinge end to hold the belay loop secure, the RockLock is your ideal belay carabiner at the wall and on the mountain.

Google.title: Trail Lite Duo System
Google.description: All the cookware for two in a compact package, the MSR Trail Lite Duo System enables you to feel that bit more at home even when space is at a premium. Nestled snugly inside the two litre aluminium pot come bowls and insulated mugs enough for a pair of backpackers to eat and drink in a civilised manner however long the trip. The hard-anodised aluminium and ceramic non-stick surface inside the pot protect it when cooking and packing and with a clear strainer lid you can see exactly when your water's boiling and thus save fuel. It's also very secure once packed, since the folding handle clips across the lid and the contents are snug inside to avoid annoying rattles as you walk. MSR's DeepDish bowls and lightweight double-wall mugs complete this versatile ensemble to add a bit of convenience to life on the trail.

Google.title: Haute Route Chamonix to Zermatt
Google.description: Undoubtedly the world's most famous ski traverse, the Haute Route takes skiers through the most prestigious ranges of the Alps, crossing the glaciers and high passes between Chamonix (F) and Zermatt(CH). Every year, around 4000 skiers undertake this unforgettable one-week traverse between the mountaineering capitals of the Alps. The introductory sections provide a wealth of practical advice on preparation, strategy and equipment, plus expert tips and a brief history of the traverse, all of which serve to highlight the alpine dimension of the Haute Route. Each stage is then presented in detail through comprehensive route descriptions, profiles of the climbs and descents, sketch maps and photos showing the route to follow.

Google.title: Everest 1953 The Epic Story
Google.description: In the only book to tell the real story of Everest 1953, Mick Conefrey reveals that what has gone down in history as a supremely well-planned attempt was in fact beset by crises ? both on and off the mountain. To succeed, team leader Colonel John Hunt and his team had to draw on unimaginable skill and determination, as well as sheer British ingenuity. Everest 1953 is not only a gripping true story of courage and adventure, but a long-overdue tribute to an under-appreciated British triumph. Revealing the answers to long-enduring controversies ? did Tenzing or Hillary actually reach the top first? ? and exploring the legacy of this great ascent, it is the perfect way to commemorate the year of the London Olympics.

Google.title: W'Proof Compression Bag Valve Medium
Google.description: The Exped Waterproof Compression Bag Medium is a totally waterproof fold drybag that has the additional benefit of three horizontal, compression straps. These straps allow the bag and its contents to be packed down to its smallest size possible, great for compressing items such as sleeping bags and bulky clothing, whilst the purge valve stops those annoying air pockets within the dry bag.

Google.title: Prolite XSmall
Google.description: To go fast you've got to go light and the Therm-A-Rest Prolite Small Mattress makes this easy while keeping you comfortable and your body warm. It's made from materials selected for packability and light weight, but you'd be wrong to think that it's all about the carry as 2.5cm of high-quality foam is more than enough for a good night's sleep for practical types. Minimalist campers and backpackers, who do everything they can to shave weight, will appreciate the comfort and insulation that the XSmall size offers at such low weight. It's the precision cut-outs in the foam that make the Prolite the lightest and most compact mattress available without impacting on comfort. Shaped for longevity, the holes shave out the maximum possible weight while maintaining the support and insulation needed for three-season trips. The extra small size is perfect when you don't mind having your head and feet on your pack, your rope or your jacket in order to carry less. This means your shoulders and pelvis, the parts exerting the most pressure, are well-cushioned and insulated but you don't have the extra weight of the rest of it. Further aided by the tapered, rounded shape, the Prolite Small tips the balance at 230 grams and rolls down to only 8 cm diameter yet has enough warmth and comfort for all but winter conditions. For a quiet night's sleep after a long day on the trail, you won't find a smaller, lighter mattress than the Prolite XSmall for the warmth.

Google.title: Trekker Lounge 20
Google.description: The Thermarest Trekker Lounge Kit 20 converts a 51cm wide Thermarest mattress into a comfortable recliner chair but packs small for a rucksack. Ideal for longer trips, base camp and family camping, this convenient and lightweight seating option fits easily over a rectangular Medium or Regular Thermarest mattress. This gives you the option to recline with your legs supported or sit more upright for cooking, eating etc. And when it finally gets to bedtime, simply unclip the sides, slip your pillow under the sleeve and it's ready for a comfy night's sleep. Home comforts that travel with you, the Thermarest Trekker Lounge makes camp life that bit more luxurious.

Google.title: Luxury Map Regular
Google.description: The Thermarest Luxury Map Regular mattress is a one-piece self-inflating mat made for sumptuous comfort, but it rolls up tight for transport too. Advanced pressure-mapping is the key to the LuxuryMap's loving embrace, providing cushioning and support exactly where you need it. That means that even women's hips and men's shoulders can sink into the die-cut areas, while the rest of the body is supported by the full-density foam everywhere else. Perfect for family- and car-camping,the soft face fabric won't irritate if your sleeping bag slips. And the whole thing rolls down to a convenient size to slot into your car boot. Ideal for frequent or occasional use under canvas, you'll discover new levels of camping comfort with the Thermarest Luxury Map.

Google.title: BaseCamp Regular
Google.description: The Thermarest Base Camp Regular brings extra comfort to your camping holidays, with plenty of depth and warmth for a good night's sleep. Made to accommodate and support your body's contours, its light but durable fabrics are soft against skin and help keep the weight down. In fact, the Base Camp is the lightest of the Thermarest Camp and Comfort self-inflating mattresses and is perfect for motorcycle touring and car-camping as well as family holidays. Comfortable, packable and doesn't cost the earth - the Thermarest Base Camp is the affordable option for comfortable camping.

Google.title: Reactor 2.5 Pot
Google.description: The MSR Reactor 2.5L Pot adds capacity to your Reactor Stove System, extending its use to group situations. Easy to stir and with enough space to boil water for up to five dry meals at once, it also melts ice and snow without batting an eyelid. The large pot accommodates the Reactor's radiant burner head and a 227g canister inside for efficient transportation. The key to the Reactor system is the base of the pot, that accepts the burner head for minimal waste heat and maximum stability. The Reactor 2.5L pot brings this excellent performance to a versatile capacity, so you can take full reliability on an extreme group trip.

Google.title: Reactor 2.5 Pot
Google.description: The MSR Reactor 2.5L Pot adds capacity to your Reactor Stove System, extending its use to group situations. Easy to stir and with enough space to boil water for up to five dry meals at once, it also melts ice and snow without batting an eyelid. The large pot accommodates the Reactor's radiant burner head and a 227g canister inside for efficient transportation. The key to the Reactor system is the base of the pot, that accepts the burner head for minimal waste heat and maximum stability. The Reactor 2.5L pot brings this excellent performance to a versatile capacity, so you can take full reliability on an extreme group trip.

Google.title: Reactor Stove 1.7L
Google.description: Extreme cooking is made easier with the MSR Reactor 1.7L Stove System, designed for the remote and challenging conditions met by expeditionists. Ideal for varied use by soloists and groups of up to three people, the 1.7L pot strikes a balance between capacity and compactness, though of course you can add extra pots for more options. Since the radiant burner head sits almost inside the base of the pot for cooking it is protected from the wind, a very high proportion of the heat goes into warming your food or melting snow - it takes around three minutes to boil a litre of water in almost any conditions! The burner head and gas canister store inside the pot for transport and the burner is compatible with all sizes of Reactor pot giving you the flexibility for different types of trip. The proven best stove system for the real world, choose a Reactor to eat quicker when it's cold.

Google.title: Hubba HP Green
Google.description: The MSR Hubba HP gives one personreliable, free-standing shelter in three-season conditions, then packs to a minimal size and weight. You'll be frankly amazed at the speed and simplicity of pitching this sturdy backpacking tent, with MSR's unique hub design making assembly as easy as joining the dots. With the poles up, you have several pitching options: three-season protection with the inner tent; Fast and Light pitching with just the flysheet and footprint (available separately); or the inner tent alone in bug-ridden heat. And all enjoy excellent space and ventilation from MSR's excellent design. In every three-season situation, the Hubba HP gives you the protection you need at lowest practical weight.

Google.title: Spectre 2 Crab
Google.description: A lighter, improved version of the original I-Beam krab; the DMM Spectre 2 has tweaks in all the right places: the only trad biner you'll ever need. The I-beam construction allows this 32g carabiner to amazingly hold 9kN with the gate open; an improved, deeper rope basket directs the load to the strongest point during a fall; and the shrouded nose reduces the chance of the gate opening when you really don't want it to. Ok, the DMM Phantom is lighter, but the Spectre works all year round - it's large enough to handle well even in winter gloves. If you count the grams but won't skimp on safety, you'll be more than satisfied with the Spectre 2.

Google.title: Folding Bucket
Google.description: freestanding, lightweight and compact solution for carrying and storing water in the outdoors. Thoughtfully designed with an additional grab handle on the base for easy pouring, the tall shape is ideal for use with water purification systems. The all-welded construction means there's no need for seam taping, keeping weight to a minimum - the 10 Litre Folding Bucket weighs less than 80g! All coatings are TPU (Thermo Poly Urethane) which is non-absorbent, food-grade and PVC free.

Google.title: 9 out of 10 Climbers
Google.description: 9 out of 10 Climbers make the same mistakes by Dave Macleod: A very comprehensive and no nonsense guide to training for climbing. Don't expect lots of pretty pictures or an easy ride. Do expect excellent, sometimes hard-hitting advice from the person possibly better qualified than anyone else to give it.

Google.title: 9 out of 10 Climbers

Google.title: Kilimanjaro Trekking Guide
Google.description: At 5895 metres (19,341ft) Kilimanjaro is Africa's highest mountain. Yet with no mountaineering skills necessary to reach the summit, even non-climbers can experience the thrill of climbing one of the world's greatest peaks. Taking you from the dusty plains of East Africa through jungle and moorland to the glacier-clad summit, this is one of the most beautiful and challenging treks there is. This Trailblazer book by Henry Stedman contains almost everything you could possibly want to know about the mountain, its ascent and its surroundings.

Google.title: Kilimanjaro Trekking Guide

This Trailblazer book by Henry Stedman contains almost everything you could possibly want to know about the mountain, its ascent and its surroundings.

Google.title: France Haute Provence Rockfax
Google.description: A Rockfax book by Adrian Berry: The first in a series of selective guidebooks, France: Haute Provence presents many of the finest sport climbing destinations in the world together in one clear and colourful book. Covering all the best areas from the magnificent walls of Cse in the north to the impeccable climbing playground of Buoux to the south, this book has a lifetime's worth of climbing waiting on its pages.

Google.title: ! Walks and Treks in the Maritime Alps
Google.description: The first English-language walking and trekking guide to the Maritime Alps, on the border of Italy and France. 18 walks and 6 treks including a 5-day traverse of the Parc National du Mercantour and a 7-day traverse of the Parco Naturale delle Alpi Marittime, written by Alpine expert Gillian Price. Great for novice walkers and seasoned trekkers.

Google.title: ! Walks and Treks in the Maritime Alps

Great for novice walkers and seasoned trekkers.

Google.title: GR20 - Corsica
Google.description: Guidebook to walking Corsica's GR20, known as the toughest waymarked trail in Europe. It makes a complete traverse through the high mountains, sometimes with hands-on scrambling. Covering 190km, it can be completed by fit walkers in about two weeks. The guide includes high- and low-level alternatives, plus extra mountain climbs.

Google.title: GR20 - Corsica

Google.title: Great Mountain Days in Snowdonia
Google.description: A guide to 40 great mountain day walks and scrambles in Snowdonia, Wales, UK by Terry Marsh. Inspirational new routes for all abilities across the National Park in Snowdon and Moel Eilio, the Glyderau, the Carneddau, Eifionydd, Siabod and the Moelwynion, Rhinogydd (the Harlech Dome), Migneint and the Arans and Cadair Idris and the Tarrens.

Google.title: ! Ecrins National Park
Google.description: Guidebook to walking in the crins national park, France. The Massif des crins is one of the most spectacular regions in all the Alps. Most of the area is a national park, with summits over 3000m high. Well-marked trails and a network of alpine huts make the Ecrins accessible to walkers.

Google.title: NeoAir Mini Pump
Google.description: Inflate any Therm-A-Rest NeoAir mattress in just three minutes and with minimal effort; the NeoAir Mini Pump is so light it can go almost anywhere. Even with 2 AAA batteries, the pump only weighs 65 grams and being small enough to pack in the end of your mattress storage bag, it won't be an inconvenience in your pack either. On reaching camp, simply flip the end of the casing, fit the rubber nozzle over the mattress valve and switch on for a perfectly inflated mattress in three minutes. At altitude this can be a huge saving of effort and in cold conditions prevents large amounts of water vapour in your breath from sitting inside your mattress. Possibly the most essential gadget for Kilimanjaro or other long, cold treks at altitude.
