Google.title: Portable Grill
Google.description: Place the BioLite Portable Grill on the BioLite Camp Stove and open up a whole new world of flavour in your camp food. If you've ever wished you didn't have to fry everything while camping, you'll love the options afforded by this compact addition. Though it looks simple, some complex engineering has gone into making the grill user-friendly. Working with the Camp Stove's fan set to 'Lo', the flip-top chimney gives you control over the spread of the flames. It also means you can add fuel and stoke the fire without having to remove your food. Two heat zones let you cook different foods together and everything becomes infused with that fantastic woodsmoke flavour. Then the legs fold in, the carry cover clips on and off you go on the road again. Extend the possibilities of your BioLite Camp Stove and bring gourmet camp cooking within reach with the BioLite Portable Grill.

Google.title: Kettle Pot
Google.description: The BioLite Kettle Pot sits perfectly on top of the BioLite Camp Stove for boiling and cooking, then the stove fits inside for easy packing. Specifically designed to make the most of the Camp Stove's heat, the massive 1.5 litre capacity takes water for several wet meals or pasta for up to four. And you don't need to worry about scratching, since ultra-thin stainless steel doesn't have any sensitive coatings to flake off. The fold-away handle is another smart feature, forming a sturdy vertical grip for reliable pouring. The heat-retaining translucent lid is held on with a silicone seal, so you can pour your coffee with ease. And once you're well fed, the stove packs inside, so the whole package takes up little extra space. A well-designed addition to your BioLite Camp Stove, take the Kettle Pot too and you're set for as long as you're out there.

Google.title: Squeezelight
Google.description: The Inova Squeeze Light is a convenient and compact LED torch that can be kept discreetly on your keys so it is always there when needed. Designed for convenient, one-handed use, the bright white works in a simple manner; it turns on when you squeeze it, off when you let go. With a rugged, heavy-duty plastic body looped on a durable strip of nylon cord with a split ring, the LED Squeeze Light is a durable lighting solution that can be easily clipped to key rings, belt loops, zipper pulls, and lanyards.

Google.title: Micro Vario Carbon Lady
Google.description: Leki Micro Vario Carbon Lady Trekking Poles are so light and easy to pack that you'll wonder how you ever got on strapping your sticks outside your pack. An evolution of the popular Leki Micro Sticks, Micro Varios offer a similarly lightweight solution with the added benefit of length adjustment to fine-tune them or for ascent. These particular poles are super-lightweight but even stronger than aluminium because they're made from pure carbon. Push-button assembly is quick and easy as well as highly reliable thanks to the kevlar-reinforced tensioning rope. The SpeedLock lever fastening provides 20cm of continuous length adjustment to get them the right length for you. Then when you reach the Via Ferrata or need to pack for your flight, just fold them down for a tiny 38 cm packed length, plenty small enough to go inside your pack or case. Lightweight doesn't have to mean compromising comfort either, since the hollow, ladies'-specific Aergon grip is rounded all over and made for slimmer hands. Plus the extended Thermo Mid grip offers an instant change in length for varied terrain. Versatile, strong and highly packable; the Micro Vario Carbon Lady pole is the lightweight hiker's dream pole.

Google.title: Cristallo Antishock
Google.description: The superstrong Leki Cristallo Antishock screams durable comfort through every inch, from vented rubber handle to carbide tip. Tough aluminium tube makes up the body of this all-rounder of a trekking pole, ideal for hiking, trekking, ski-touring and more at any time of year. It's also secure - the Leki SpeedLock on the top joint offers quick, robust adjustment as you change terrain, whilst the SuperLock twist adjustment on the bottom joint holds a massive 140kg. The SuperLock has more tricks than that up its sleeve though, housing the SAS Lite sprung shock-absorbing system. This cushions your wrists from repeated impacts, supported as they are in the quick-drying air-textured straps. A great pole for use on hard surfaces and long journeys, the Cristallo Antishock will keep your hands comfortable all the way.

Google.title: Softlite
Google.description: The Leki Softlite trekking pole is lightweight and easy to use, but don't be thinking it's basic. No, this practical pole may be ideal for lightweight hiking, mountain marathons and ultralight backpacking, but it's also great for everything else too - from ambling up a munro to ski touring in the depths of winter. The poles' strength comes from the combination of high tensile strength aluminium with the reliable SpeedLock camming system. The pole itself is kept thin too, for even lower weight and a streamlined look. On top, the handle is shaped for comfort in most hands - soft rubber is vented and the tough wrist strap has a soft layer where it supports your wrist. So if you want one lightweight, reliable pole for all your self-propelled journeys, you can't go wrong with the Softlite by Leki.

Google.title: Thermolite
Google.description: Leki Thermolite trekking poles have the strength, durability and all-round good design to support your every hard challenge. Everything about them is selected for performance - the high grade aluminium alloy tubing, the SuperLock adjustment system and the Aergonomic foam handle all give it the substance and style of a pole to rely on. The SuperLock adjustment is a particular highlight when it comes to strength; holding 140kg at maximum strength it won't let you down once set. Then you have all-day comfort from the hand-shaped, moulded foam grip and air-textured, quick drying strap. A high-performing pole that will see you through many a tough day on mountains, hills and more.

Google.title: Trail
Google.description: The Leki Trail pole was made for where reliability and strength are critical - high alpine routes and remote expeditions. They're all about strength, with thicker-than average tube sections and Leki SuperLock adjusters to hold huge amounts of weight when you need them to. That's not to say that trekking comfort is ignored though - the Round Top Comfort grip with Soft rubber is shaped to work with most walkers' hands, reducing the amount of force needed to hold the pole. And the adjustable webbing wriststrap supports all day at minimal weight. Ideal for hard ascents and rough terrain, the Trail is what you need to depend upon when you're a long way from anywhere.

Google.title: Cressida
Google.description: The Leki Cressida trekking pole has the same design as the Leki Softlite, but it's smaller and lighter with a grip shaped for feminine hands. It's made for keeping you safely on your feet through challenging terrain, with SpeedLock adjusters that allow you to change the length in seconds to fit the gradient at every stage. The Cressida is kept lightweight and small-packing as well, so it fits easily on the outside of a smaller ladies' pack. And the foam grip is shaped specifically to accommodate a slim hand. Designed for ladies but with all the strength and support of the equivalent men's pole, the Cressida is ideal for all your big days out.

Google.title: Easy Bag
Google.description: The Leki Trekking Easy Bag is the easy way to carry your poles from place to place safely and without dirtying the inside of your car or case. Though when packed it takes up only a fist-sized space, this tough drawstring bag extends to 93cm to hold the longest collapsed trekking poles. Its two fastenings ensure a secure fit - a drawstring over the baskets and a webbing strap with buckle round the top. And the bottom section is made of tough fabric to stand up to those carbide tips. A must for anyone travelling with their poles, the Trekking Easy bag takes your sticks in style.

Google.title: Supreme Shark
Google.description: The Leki Supreme Shark Nordic Walking pole is Leki's premium aluminium pole, taking over from the Prestige for top-end performance at a reasonable price. Like all the adjustable poles in the range, the Supreme comes with two sections of strong aluminium, with the extremely strong SuperLock adjuster between them. But the natural cork grip and Trigger Shark glove attachment set the Supreme Shark apart from the rest. Cork gives you a cushioned, comfortable grip that manages moisture and avoids rubbing. And the Trigger Shark attachment adds ease of use and doesn't require a chunky piece of plastic hanging off your glove. In all, it's a versatile and comfortable pole ideal for tailoring to your perfect length for a long life of health-giving Nordic Walking.

Google.title: Tear-Aid Fabric Repair Pack
Google.description: With a Storm Tear-Aid Fabric Repair Pack you can fix almost anything with a hole or tear - super-sticky, super-stretchy and airtight for instant repairs. Five small patches and two large bond to everything from canvas to fibreglass, through Dacron, polyurethane and neoprene. In fact about the only material you can't use it on is vinyl! You also get a full set of instructions and an alcohol wipe for preparing the surface. Once applied, you can use the item immediately as the adhesive is 90 percent bonded instantly, reaching full adhesion within an hour. It stretches and moves with the fabric too, so even if it's applied on an elbow or over an edge it's stay in place and well-stuck. Give damaged waterproofs, tents, rucksacks and more a new lease of life - Tear-Aid patches can be taken on every trip for instant permanent repairs even in the field.

Google.title: Footwear Proofer 300ml
Google.description: Storm Footwear Proofer does exactly what it says on the tin; no fuss, no worries, just quick restoration to your DWR's full performance. Quick and easy to apply through the aerosol spray format, a light coat on dry shoes dries in seconds and leaves no trace. Apart from causing water to bead up on the surface that is! The formula is as ecologically sound as is currently technically possible for a footwear proofer too, being based on C6 fluorocarbons (less harmful than the C8 fluorocarbons used in most DWR treatments). It's suitable for use on all footwear materials - fabrics, leather, Gore-Tex, even suede - and, once dry, you can't see or even feel it's there. Ideal for re-proofing your outdoor boots or shoes, but also for adding water-resistance to work shoes, fashion boots and pretty much anything else. A DWR exactly as it should be - quick, easy and effective so your feet stay dry for longer.

Google.title: Footwear Proofer 300ml

Google.title: Deodoriser 75ml Spray
Google.description: Kill the stink with Storm Deodoriser, a quick and easy way to keep your shoes, helmet, gloves and everything else smelling fresher for longer. Being based on a solution of silver ions, a couple of pumps of this effectively stop bacteria reproducing in your gear. And since it's their waste that does the smelling, the less bacteria there are, the less your kit stinks. Supplied in a handy-sized spray, the ideal is to give each item a quick spray while it's still warm after use. The first spray should last about a week, then the build-up effect makes subsequent treatments last longer. The more occasions you spray, the better it works. Any waterproofing on the inside won't be affected and the light fragrance immediately masks that warm feet smell so your kit bag or wardrobe doesn't cause asphyxiation. A smart solution for all those items that you dread taking off at the end of a warm day.

Google.title: Fast Dry Proofer 500ml Spray
Google.description: Storm Fast Dry Proofer does exactly that - restores or adds a DWR finish to tents, backpacks, clothing and any other fabric quickly, easily and eco-friendly-ly. It won't stain, dries at speed and leaves breathability untouched - sounds almost too good to be true, but we've seen it in action! The environmental credentials stem from the C6 fluorocarbons it's based on. These are less harmful than the C8 fluorocarbons used in most proofers if they get into water courses etc. Plus because it's in a handy spray can for direct application, less gets wasted between can and gear. It also doesn't require a heat treatment, so there's no energy used there either. It's as simple as spraying it evenly over the surface and leaving it to dry; add weather protection in minutes with Storm Fast Dry Proofer.

Google.title: Fast Dry Proofer 500ml Spray

Google.title: Eco+ Twin Pack 300ml
Google.description: Try it and you'll love the ease and simplicity of the Storm Eco+ Twin Pack for cleaning and proofing all your outdoor clothes - in one wash! That's right, both products go in the washing machine drawer at the same time! And between them they remove dirt and reinstate the DWR coating on 2-3 garments of any type, all in one 30 degree cycle. There's no need to scrub your machine drawer or do an empty cycle beforehand either - the Storm Proofing system is designed to make it easy to look after your gear. But that's not the only advantage. The Storm Eco+ proofing system is also very environmentally friendly. That's because it has a C0 formulation that completely avoids the use of the potentially harmful fluorocarbons that you'll find in the majority of other proofers. The only trade-off is that your gear will need a bit of heat to cure the treatment - once dry, a spell on low in the tumble-dryer or under a cool iron (and a tea-towel) will do the trick. Having done this, your waterproofs, softshells, insulated clothes, gloves, fleeces or whatever you want to proof, will be just as water-repellent, if not more so, than when new. Plus it's actually more abrasion-resistant than other treatments in testing. Worth a try, wouldn't you say? Especially as 300ml will do four wash loads. Experience the future of DWR treatment with the Storm Proofing system.

Google.title: Eco+ Proofer 300ml Spray
Google.description: The Storm Eco+ Proofer Spray allows directed application of a water-resistant DWR finish to virtually any fabric. Working with the Storm Cleaner it's environmentally friendly and easy to use. Simply spray evenly over damp or dry, clean fabric, drip dry and then cure in the tumble dryer. The result is an effective water-repellent finish to your waterproofs, softshell, fleece, walking trousers or almost anything else you can get in a tumble dryer. It's actually more abrasion-resistant than other treatments, believe it or not. And because it's C0 ie fluorocarbon-free, it's not going to harm the environment. Is there anything more you could want? Keep your gear at its best without harming the environment, the Storm Eco+ Proofer Spray makes light work of blocking heavy weather.

Google.title: Eco+ Proofer 300ml
Google.description: Storm Eco+ Proofer forms the business end of the Storm Proofing System, giving you an easily applied but highly effective DWR for virtually any fabric. Designed for use in your washing machine, it goes in the drawer at the same time as the Storm Cleaner for cleaning and proofing in one cycle. But it's ecologically sound as well as straightforward to use. Completely free of fluorocarbons, PFOA and PFOS, the dendromer-based technology is approved by Greenpeace. It lasts longer than some other treatments because it'se more abrasion-resistant. And because only one cycle is needed, it uses less water than other systems. Plus it's more economical, giving you four wash loads of 2-3 garments out of each 300ml bottle. The only trade-off is the need for heat to cure the treatment - once dry, a spell on low in the tumble-dryer or under a cool iron (and a tea-towel) will do the trick. It's ideal for anything you want to repel water (as long as it fits in your washing machine) - hardshells, softshells, fleeces, windshells and more. An easy to use, eco-friendly proofer that will stay in place for longer - is this the ideal product for maintaining your waterproof gear?

Google.title: Cleaner 300ml
Google.description: Storm Cleaner gently but effectively cleans all your technical outdoor gear without excess foam or stubborn residues being left on your clothes. It also forms part of the Storm Proofing system - if you put Storm Proofer into the fabric softener section of the washer you can do both in one wash cycle and save water. That's because it's pH neutral, so even in hard water you don't get the reaction that leaves those streaky white marks. You can also use it to handwash individual or bulky items like rucksacks. Totally PFC-free and happiest at 30 degrees, Storm Cleaner is the eco-friendly cleaner for all your outdoor gear.

Google.title: All Clear System 0.75L
Google.description: With the Camelbak All Clear purification system you have UV water treatment and storage facilities in one handy package - ideal for minimalist and fast-moving trips. Not only is it compact, the All Clear system is quick and easy to use too - no pumping, tablets or waiting around. Simply fill, switch on and agitate for 60 seconds for reliably safe drinking water. There are a couple of provisos - the water must be clear for the UV light to penetrate, but there's a pre-filter available separately that helps stop debris getting in when you're out in the wilds. And it's not too happy at freezing temperatures, so you'll have to keep it in your jacket if you're going somewhere cold. But apart from those it's ready for anything, deactivating viruses and protozoa as well as bacteria from springs, streams, taps and any other sources you find on your travels. It also comes with a case and simple cap so you can protect the treatment cap on the move. A seriously useful bit of kit to avoid carrying all your water on your back, the All Clear system makes it safer to rely on nature.

Google.title: All Clear System 0.75L

Google.title: All Clear Pre-Filter
Google.description: The Camelbak All Clear Pre-Filter sits neatly over the neck of your All Clear bottle while filling, to keep your water as clean as possible for treatment. The All Clear system works effectively only on water that's clear and without 'bits', so it's important to keep your water as clean as possible from the very start. Not only does this sturdy pre-filter prevent debris like sediment, insects, plant parts and worse from getting into your bottle. It's also a safeguard that protects the threaded neck from the untreated water, adding to your safety. A vital addition to your All Clear system when you'll be filling it from streams and rivers etc on a remote trip.

Google.title: Antidote 3L
Google.description: The CamelBak 3L Antidote Reservoir is a fully featured water reservoir with a low profile design and centre baffling, it offers excellent stability and easy pack loading. The Quick Link System allows the tube to disconnect cleanly and uses an auto shut-off feature to stop any drips or spills from one end while the Big Bite Valve mouth piece self-seals immediately after use on the other. The taste of the water is kept pure and fresh using CamelBak's PureFlow Tube, thus ensuring your drink stays refreshing and doesn't carry the 'plastic' taste of some other systems. More than fresh tasting, the Antidote uses HydroGuard technology to provide anti-microbial protection. This is accomplished by inhibiting the growth of bacteria that can often cause odours, discolouration and deterioration of the bottle.

Google.title: Cleaning Brush Kit
Google.description: The CamelBak Cleaning Brush Kit is the ideal cleaning solution for your water reservoir system. The Brush Kit comes with a flexible tube brush to thread all the way through the tube for easy cleaning and a specially designed reservoir brush; with a deliberate bend in to make it easy to clean the entire inner surface.

Google.title: Cleaning Brush Kit

Google.title: Chalk Bag Belt
Google.description: The DMM Chalk Bag Belt is a useful replacement that fits the Tube, Traction and Trad chalkbags, or most other chalkbags in existence. Once threaded, your chalkbag will sit comfortably in the small of your back, or round the side or even at the front for those off-width cracks. Supplied in assorted colours (call if you need a particular colour), to coordinate or compliment your existing kit, it's just as suitable for holding your trousers up, with a lightweight webbing buckle for security. A handy spare or vital accessory for every climbing trip.
